reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Pots', 'author': 'CJ Hudson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These pots are wonderful! They heat evenly, clean up nicely, and look great. A little pricey but worth it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This was part of the 12-piece set I purchased.', 'author': 'Judy L.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This was part of the 12-piece set I purchased. I have looked at this cookware before and have seen a few advertisements on it. In the past, I hesitated trying it since, in most of the pictures and videos, it looks like it has a bumpy or rough interior. When I saw the 7-quart hybrid sauce pan, I decided I had to try it to replace a 7-quart Staub Dutch oven that I have. I was so impressed by this sauce pan, I decided to buy the 12-piece set of this cookware. This set was shipped in two boxes. One box include the 6-piece pot set with lids ( 2 and 3 quart pots and 8 quart stock pot), and the other box included the 6-piece frying pan set with lids (8, 10, and 12 inch frying pans with lids).I cook quite a lot and have quit a lot of cookware of various types and brands, including Staub, Le Creuset, cast iron, , Tramontina, carbon steel, Calphalon stainless steel, and Ninja Premium cookware. In most of these, I have complete, or almost complete, sets of every piece available in each type of cookware. Each of these has their pros and cons, and all are very non-stick aside from cast iron and carbon steel that must be well seasoned.Since this review is for the HexClad cookware, I will not get into the pros and cons of each type of cookware, but will compare the HexClad cookware to some of them and let you know why I prefer this cookware over some of the others.It should be noted that it is suggested to wash and season the cookware with vegetable oil before using. I used Crisco shortening which I also use on my cast iron pans. When I seasoned the pans, the oil was completely absorbed. After the initial seasoning, these pans should not need to be seasoned again even when cleaned with soap and water. Cast iron and carbon steel pans should be seasoned after every use.So, what do I like about this cookware as compared to the other cookware I have?1 - Cast iron, and enameled cast iron is very heavy and must be seasoned after every use to maintain it. This cookware does not required seasoning after it is done initially. Carbon steel is not as heavy, but must also be seasoned after every use.2 - Stainless steel cookware needs to be cleaned very time with Bar Keeper's Friend to keep it clean and shiny. The HexClad cookware does have stainless steel on the exterior, but is easier to keep looking shiny since cooking is not done on it. Wash and dry works.3 - Most of the cookware mentioned above can be relatively nonstick when used and seasoned properly and after learning how to use it. Stainless cookware can be more challenging since temperature and what you cook can be issues. Cast iron, carbon steel, and even enameled cookware depends on persistent seasoning after every use aside from the Ninja Premium cookware that maintains a nonstick, easy to clean surface as does the HexClad cookware. Other than Tramontina cookware, the nonstick surfaces of most are durable.4 - As for weight, the cast iron and enameled cast iron (Staub and Le Creuset) are the heaviest, carbon steel comes in second, and HexClad and Ninja are about the same.5- The warranty for HexClad is lifetime vs. the Ninja warranty that is 5-10 year depending on whether you register cookware on the Ninja website. For the HexClad cookware, you must save your purchase receipt.This is all of the differences I can think of for now. If I think of more, I will add them. For now, I am impressed with the HexClad cookware, but I will not likely eliminate much of the cookware I already have. As mentioned previously, each has their own benefits. I may eventually decide to eliminate some of the heavier cookware as it is more difficult to use. I may also eliminate cookware that requires more maintenance.I will update this review if my opinion changes. I hope this review was helpful for you.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really are worth the higher price so far.', 'author': 'Fuzms', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Lately I had been treating pans as almost disposable. Replacing cheap nonstick pans every year or so. A family member talked me into trying these. They really do feel better quality. Heavier, better heat distribution, better handle attachment. Nonstick is also great.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely love my new pots', 'author': 'Tricia G', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Love my new HexClad hybrid pots! To be fair, since I just received them today, I only rated heat distribution and durability with 4 stars because I can’t say anything yet regarding those points as I have not used them yet. They certainly are easy to wash, but I just washed them to get them prepped for seasoning before use. I also have the HexClad 5 qt. Covered Dutch Oven.They have a nice weight to them, but not as heavy as cast iron or LeCreuset pieces. They definitely arrive securely packed in their own boxes and each piece is covered with a nice cloth type storage bag. Ha! ha! UPS… you can’t beat this packaging up!I can’t wait to order all of the rest of the pieces I want! They are a bit expensive, but in the long run they will last for many years.I saw ONE review that said she thought they were a waste of money because she said the food stuck to her pan and she had a hard time cleaning it. Out of ALL the reviews I read, it was the only one who said anything negative. My opinion on that review is that she most likely didn’t follow directions when she received it and didn’t SEASON the pan first before using it; and so blamed the pan!I did not find a single flaw or scratch on any of the pieces I received. They have a beautiful shiny mirror like finish on the outside, and all the welds on the handles are strong and clean.I would highly recommend them! Stop thinking about it and just buy them! You won’t be disappointed!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome', 'author': 'Ask N RN', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought the Pans and these pots. Everything the company says about their products is 100% true! I have a Glass Top Electric Stove, I cooked with these pots and pans between Low and 2. They cook even and heat even, so far the best pots and pans set I ever owned. I know they cost a lot, but let's look at that, 3 pans with lids cost me $70 each. I can spend $40 for a fiberware maybe with the lid and it's a pain to clean. I cooked with one of the pans and cleaned up in less then 1 minute.. Buy theses pots and pans! 🙂", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Everything they claim and more.', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We've been using this cookware for several months now and haven't found anything we didn't like about the sets we bought.Handles actually remain cool on the skillets and sauce pans, the hexclad coating covers not just the interiors but also the bottoms and is incredibly easy to clean. title: HexClad Hybrid Nonstick 6-Piece Fry Pan Set, 8, 10 and 12-Inch Frying Pans with Tempered Glass Lids, Stay-Cool Handles, Dishwasher and Oven Safe, Induction Ready, Compatible with All Cooktops
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best pans', 'author': 'Jason', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are by far the best pans I've ever owned. Worth the money !", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super Impressed - Recommending to Others', 'author': 'WV Shopper', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Hexclad immediately drew my attention with their sexy hexagonal design and contrasting colored cookware (instead of just an ordinary monochrome stainless steel). So pleased that I ordered the largest set that I could find, along with some additional pots (18 pieces total). I pre-washed, then afterwards pre-seasoned the interior with olive oil (as recommended). After using the nicely-weighted pots/pans for two months, I concur with the reviews below (e.g., very durable, very easy cleanup, very pleased) The equal heat distribution is also worth noting since it enables cooking on lower heat and NOT having to shift items around in the pan to avoid hot spots. I use my 1-quart pot as often as I do my larger pots!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Hexcellent Culinary Magic', 'author': 'Riad B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Prepare to be hex-cited, fellow food enthusiasts, because the Hexclad pan set is about to change your cooking game in ways you never hex-pected! (See what I did there? Sorry, couldn't resist.)When it comes to kitchen sorcery, this pan set is nothing short of magical. From the moment you lay eyes on its sleek hexagonal design, you know you're in for a culinary adventure like no other. It's like having a cauldron straight out of Hogwarts, minus the bubbling potions and broomsticks, of course.Let's talk about the non-stick hexagonal surface, which is truly a kitchen wizard's dream. It's like the Teflon gods descended from the heavens and bestowed upon us a pan that makes food glide effortlessly like a graceful ballerina on ice. No more scrubbing and scraping stuck-on messes while muttering incantations under your breath.But wait, there's more! The Hexclad pan set also features a hybrid construction that combines the best of both stainless steel and non-stick materials. It's like having the strength of a dragon and the gentleness of a unicorn all in one pan. It heats up evenly, retains heat like a master spellcaster, and allows for precise temperature control.Now, let me tell you about the first time I cooked with these pans. As I gently sautéed some veggies, I couldn't help but feel a sense of culinary wizardry coursing through my veins. The food cooked to perfection, evenly browned and beautifully caramelized. I almost expected sparks to fly out of the pan, but alas, it seems the magic was contained within the hexagonal surface.The ergonomic handles are like the wands of comfort, offering a secure grip that won't leave your hands feeling like they've been subjected to a Petrificus Totalus spell. And did I mention that these pans are oven-safe too? That's right, you can conjure up a masterpiece on the stovetop and then effortlessly transfer it to the oven for the finishing touches.In conclusion, if you're looking to add a touch of culinary enchantment to your kitchen, the Hexclad pan set is the answer to your cooking prayers. Whether you're a seasoned chef or a beginner in the world of potions and recipes, these pans will have you casting spells of deliciousness with every dish you create. So wave your spatula like a wand, slip on your chef's hat, and prepare to unlock a realm of culinary magic that will leave your taste buds spellbound. Accio Hexclad pan set!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality is not cheap', 'author': 'Dennis Strapon Jr', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These pans are not for freshman college kids. These pans are for the serious home cook who truely enjoys the process of cooking and can appreciate perfection. These pans are so perfectly designed to deliver high performance, quality meals, with complete temperature control. Its amazing how little heat it takes for these pans to perform compared to literally every other pan Ive ever used. They are not cheap, and are not light, but the quality is second to none. Im a big Gordon Ramsay fan, but was a little leary about these pans, thinking he's just trying to make money, but after using them, he's the perfect spokesman for this product! Try them, you will only be disappointed you didnt buy them sooner!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth It and More', 'author': 'Jon M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Personal Experience: These pans are awesome to cook in! They distribute heat extremely well when cooking which is one of the key things to look at inside of a good cooking skillet. Cleaning I personally add a bit of water to the pan and use a high heat silicon spatula to remove anything left after cooking. HexClad does say you can use metal utensils on them. Personally, I wouldn't recommend that one bit. Hexclad does give a lifetime warranty but not from minor scratches, so buyer beware. Yes, they are scratch resistant, NOT scratch proof.These are not your typical nonstick or stainless steel skillets. They are designed to work with the functionality of both styles of pans. You need to season these skillets prior to use. You do not season them like a normal seasoning of a cast iron for say, but inside the packaging or HexClads Website it will tell you how to season them.Overall, I am very pleased with this purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The hype is real, but... it turns out you have to know how to cook', 'author': 'Karl Houseknecht', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'If I\'d only had YouTube to assist in my purchase decision, I\'d have never bought these pans. Everyone is a critic. Everyone complains the pans aren\'t non-stick. It also turns out that none of these people giving the pans terrible reviews seem to have the faintest idea how to cook in the first place.If you dump scrambled eggs into a dry non-stick pan of any make or model, they\'re going to stick. And probably burn. Every single YouTube review tries the "egg test" by putting an egg into a hot, dry pan and guess what happens? If you dump frozen ravioli into a dry non-stick pan, they aren\'t going to thaw, much less cook, and they\'ll have scorch marks. If you try to make fried rice in a non-stick wok but don\'t use a drop of oil, the rice is going to stick and burn. If I tune into your HexClad product review and you tell me that you had to go to the store to buy vegetable oil to season the pans because you don\'t normally use any in your cooking, I\'m going to turn that video right off.So here\'s the deal: Are HexClad non-stick pans? Yes. And also no. They are hybrid cookware. But they are unique hybrid cookware unlike any I\'ve owned or tried. Must you use some oil in your cooking? 100% yes. It\'s actually in the instruction sheet that comes with the pans. Also, it\'s proper technique. How else are you going to ensure proper heat transfer to the food? Again, think about what you\'re buying here: hybrid cookware. A hybrid of what? A hybrid of non-stick cookware, which, no matter the brand, still will require some kind of oil or fat to be properly non-stick, and of stainless steel cookware, which most definitely requires oil or fat to be non-stick.The bottom line on this whole "they aren\'t non-stick" nonsense is that they most certainly are. When you want them to be. When you use proper cooking techniques.Now, how did they work out for me? I\'m not a chef. I\'m a home cook. But I like to think I\'m an above average home cook. Two of my good friends are foodies. One of them actually is a chef. The other is a skilled home cook and recently purchased a set of HexClad, which he really likes. We often cook and eat together.First test, after following the seasoning instructions, was with the 12" pan. I made sichuan chicken using boneless, skinless chicken thighs. While skeptical at first, I heated the pan on medium low as instructed, thinking no way is this going to be hot enough. With a little oil in the pan once it came up to temperature (within 2 minutes at that), the chicken cooked and even browned. Developed a nice sear on the outside. Beautiful, gorgeous color. And yet, when turning the meat it released from the pan with zero resistance and no residue left stuck on the pan surface. Removing the chicken, I added a tbsp more oil and in went the peppers and onion. Again, a gorgeous result. Nice searing and no sticking. Added the meat back, added sauce, and the same meal I had prepared the night before in my quality non-stick skillet actually looked far more appetizing. And it was delicious. I dare say, even better due to the increased Maillard reaction over standard non-stick pans. Clean up entailed a wet sponge and a gentle wipe and rinse and it was clean. Nothing stuck. No discoloration. Soap and water finish.After enjoying my meal, I just had to know if the pans were going to pass the test that would make them a keeper for me: the French Omelette test. So I heated up the 10" pan, scrambled and seasoned three eggs, and threw a knob of butter into the pan. Medium low heat was plenty enough to get the job done. I worked quickly, keeping the eggs moving to avoid forming large curds. Once nearly set, I began rolling. The egg came away from the pan without a single stick, and without even the need to add more butter to release it as I would in my regular non-stick pans. Perfect, soft, yellow (not browned), creamy French Omelette. Clean up was a non-event. Aside from a bit of butter there wasn\'t anything for the soap, water, and sponge to remove. This test sealed the deal for me.I have other decent pans: All-Clad D3 12" and 10" pans, and three non-stick Oxo 8", 10", and 12" pans (top rated by America\'s Test Kitchen). The All-Clads can work okay, but they were mostly a disappointment. They take too long to heat up, the heat dissipates quickly when food is added, and they have cold spots around the outside where there isn\'t direct flame. The Oxo pans are actually pretty great, but they have rubber handles which can\'t go into the oven, and even medium heat just isn\'t hot enough. Not the pan\'s fault, but you\'ll never get a sear on a non-stick surface. My goal here was to have ONE set of pans that could get proper searing, could be used in the oven, and still have non-stick properties. I have achieved that goal with the HexClad pans. My All-Clad and Oxo pans will be gifted to someone. I have no need for them anymore.Handles: Nice, fat handles on the HexClad that don\'t turn in your hands or get hot. The worst thing about the All-Clad D3\'s are the handles. I have nearly dumped the contents of both pans when tossing as the handles rotated in my palm. They are the absolute worst. I absolutely LOVE the HexClad handles.Lids: Every HexClad pan came with a nice, glass lid that fits perfectly, and has a steam vent. All-Clad? Because my D3 set didn\'t come with lids initially, All-Clad doesn\'t and won\'t sell them separately. I called All-Clad when I got them and asked if they\'d sell me some lids and they basically told me to go pound sand. They were actually rude and dismissive.Heat distribution: As mentioned, the All-Clad D3\'s didn\'t evenly distribute the heat to the outsides of the pan surface that weren\'t directly over flame, nor did they keep the heat when food was added. Even cranking the flame up to high was never enough to get a good sear. Not so with the HexClad. I was sure that the warning to not heat them above medium had something to do with the non-stick surface (and it might), but it\'s just not necessary to go any higher. The outsides of the pan are just as hot as the middle and they sear so well, keeping their heat even as food is added. They perform almost like carbon steel or cast iron in this regard.Non-stick: Covered this, but it bears repeating that these actually are non-stick when used properly.Appearance: They\'re gorgeous, aren\'t they? My friend\'s set has no discoloration after several months of daily, hard use, and he\'s never had to use Barkeeper\'s Friend or any scouring. They are absolutely stunning under the LED cook lights of my hood. Prettier by far than the All-Clad.I\'ve ordered the 2, 3, and 8 QT pot set, which arrives tomorrow, and expect to be equally happy if these pans are any indication. I also have a 10" wok arriving next week for my near daily stir fries. At some point, I may also add a 1 QT pot and 7 QT deep saute.The bottom line is that these pans aren\'t going to miraculously make you cook better. But they WILL reward good technique with superior results. I was skeptical coming into this that I wouldn\'t like them nearly as much as what I already had but any hesitation is gone. The hype is real with this tech.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 16, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This was part of the 12-piece set I ordered', 'author': 'Judy L.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This was part of the 12 piece set I ordered that was shipped in 2 boxes. In most of these, I have complete, or almost complete, sets of every piece available in each type of cookware. Each of these has their pros and cons, and all are very non-stick aside from cast iron and carbon steel that must be well seasoned.Since this review is for the HexClad cookware, I will not get into the pros and cons of each type of cookware, but will compare the HexClad cookware to some of them and let you know why I prefer this cookware over some of the others.It should be noted that it is suggested to wash and season the cookware with vegetable oil before using. Cast iron and carbon steel pans should be seasoned after every use.So, what do I like about this cookware as compared to the other cookware I have?1 - Cast iron, and enameled cast iron is very heavy and must be seasoned after every use to maintain it. This cookware does not required seasoning after it is done initially. The HexClad cookware does have stainless steel on the exterior, but is easier to keep looking shiny since cooking is not done on it. Wash and dry works.3 - Most of the cookware mentioned above can be relatively nonstick when used and seasoned properly and after learning how to use it. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars good cookware', 'author': 'jose navarrete', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Title: A Healthy and Versatile Cookware Set - CAROTE 10 Pcs Nonstick Granite CookwareRating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5)Review:The CAROTE 10-Piece Pots and Pans Set is a true game-changer in the world of cookware. It's not just non-stick; it's also SGS and EUROFIN approved, ensuring that it's free from harmful substances like PFOS and PFOA. With this set, you can cook with confidence, knowing that your daily culinary creations are both safe and healthy.The set's composition is comprehensive and well thought out, making it a kitchen essential. It includes various pans and saucepans, all with lids, to cater to your everyday cooking needs. Whether you're whipping up a quick stir-fry or simmering a hearty casserole, this set has you covered.Cleaning these pots and pans is a breeze. It heats up quickly and evenly, thanks to the extended bottom design. The high magnetic conductive stainless steel base allows it to work seamlessly on all stovetops, including induction. This adaptability ensures that this set can serve you well no matter what type of stovetop you have.Lastly, the CAROTE team takes quality seriously. Each piece of cookware undergoes a strict multi-inspection process to ensure that it meets high standards. In the rare event of receiving defect items due to delivery, their commitment to customer satisfaction shines through, as they offer a 100% refund or a new replacement.In summary, the CAROTE 10-Piece Pots and Pans Set is a kitchen marvel. Its focus on health, eco-friendliness, and versatility make it a standout choice for home chefs. The included cookware not only meets your daily cooking needs but also simplifies the cleaning process. If you're looking for a cookware set that's healthy, environmentally conscious, and compatible with various stovetops, this is the one to invest in. The CAROTE set deserves a perfect 5 out of 5 rating, and it's a true kitchen asset that won't disappoint.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice pans', 'author': 'Karl L.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice looking and very nonstick but the saucepans have pouring spout that won’t allow the lid to seal so you can’t cook rice other than that they look great, cook well, and clean easy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for induction cooking.', 'author': 'K. I have been tossing out my older non-stick pans that have scratched because of concerns about the possibility of toxins being released into our food. This set seemed like a healthier alternative, so I decided to give them a try , especially at this price. I have been cooking for more than 50 years and have owned a large variety of pans. These are now my favorite. They truly are non-stick and so easy to clean. They stack together nicely, so don't take up a lot of space in my cupboard. I really like the sizes of these pans--they are perfect for everything I cook. The generous handle makes them easy to handle. A bonus is that they are so darn attractive!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Would be great if they were more durable. UPDATED REVIEW TO REFLECT GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE', 'author': 'Chris', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I purchased these pots and pans as a Christmas gift for my wife, who is the primary cook in our household. Initially, we were impressed with their aesthetic appeal and the comfortable feel they offer. These cookware items are notably lighter than our older Calphalon set, making them easier to handle. It's worth mentioning that while the handles have a wood-like appearance, they are not made of wood and will burn your hand if you touch them while hot.In terms of performance, during our limited usage, they have demonstrated even cooking, which is a significant plus. Furthermore, following the manufacturer's recommendation to allow them to cool down before cleaning, we found them exceptionally easy to clean.However, the main issue we encountered relates to the handles. Although they have an attractive design, we experienced a durability concern. During the very first use, while boiling eggs on medium heat, a portion of the handle unexpectedly broke off with a loud pop. We were surprised to find a piece of the handle on our griddle cover. I've attached pictures taken immediately after this incident, including one of the underside of the handle.In summary, we are quite fond of these pots and pans with the exception of their durability. Given this issue, we are considering returning them and exploring alternative options. We are also looking into the possibility of getting a replacement pot to prevent any safety concerns related to the handle. It's worth noting that our experience may be an isolated incident, as we haven't come across similar reports in the few Amazon reviews we've read. I'll update this review to share the resolution once it's reached.UPDATE 01/11/2024:After posting my above update, I planned to reach out to Carote. I was not able to do so that day and when I was about to do so two days later, I noticed I had already received an email from Carote Brands via my Amazon account. By reaching out to me, they saved me additional time of having to reach out to them. They resolved the issue in a way which leaves me completely satisfied and will to try their products going forward. As for our pans, they have been working really well. I am still continually surprised at how light weight they are based on how the look. The non-stick feature has been very good as well. Even when letting melted cheese dry in the pot, I soak it in water for about ten minutes and then everything wipes out with a sponge. I haven't had any issues with cooking food or cleaning the dishes. Due to the warning in the packaging and the warnings in the instructions, we keep a cloth between the pans/pots that we are stacking to protect the material. I have updated my 2-star review to 4 stars to reflect their excellent customer service and the quality of the product, with the exception of my first review. I will update this in the future if I can remember or if someone reaches out.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Durable material, non-stick, and easy to clean.', 'author': 'David', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this cookware. I have a propane tank for the stove so I needed something that could handle the heat better than my old cookware as it seems propane burns a bit hotter than gas. This set filled the bill and the heat distributes evenly throughout the pans. You have to be a bit careful with the placement of the handles as they should not be over direct heat for very long. The handles (made of Bakelite) will blister. I have used them in the oven (max 375F) but I wrapped a couple of wet paper towels around the handle and then wrapped that with aluminum foil to protect them from the heat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So pretty and durable', 'author': 'Patty', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased these a few months ago and wanted to wait to review these. I still LOVE them! I been telling my family about them and they have purchased their own as well. These pots are so beautiful, and work so well. You can cook anything and wont stick! This is great for any level of cooking. I never thought I would love pots and pans so much, but these have replaced all of mine in my kitchen! Highly recommend these.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great induction cookware; especially like the handles', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We decided to try induction, so got an induction hotplate and this cookware set. Cookware is great - heats easily and seemingly uniformly, works great on both the induction hotplate and out radiant range. So far, cleans easily with a sponge, even with stuck-on curried rice (after a night's soaking, at least). Love the feel of the handles, which look and feel like hardwood, but are apparently some synthetic material. Like the set so much we bought another identical set for our vacation home.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars PTFE Yes or No!?', 'author': 'Brandie', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I have not used the product. This is just my take on PTFE, non-stick, PFAS health concerns etc. For various versions of the question "is this product PTFE free?", there are many \'Yes\' answers in the Q&A\'s for this product, but some say it does have in fact PTFE. So what is true? To say it upfront, according to my findings it does contain PTFE. But that doesn\'t necessarily mean this is a bad and toxic product. In fact if you want Non-stick and something that lasts longer than ceramic non-stick this is probably a decent product at the price point and good somewhat healthy option! I say \'somewhat\' because it\'s complicated and everyone has a personal threshold of what they consider healthy!If you are interested in more depth why I think that please read-on. I\'m not a chemist, just a curious consumer. I had ordered this set during Holiday \'23 sales events and fell for the marketing of Eco-Friendly, PFOS,PFOA No Lead, No Cadmium. There is also only one spot in the product description where it says PFAS free (Image with Mom and Daughter prepping food) However after the fact I looked at the Q&A and it started to stress me out. Greenwashing is everywhere, so caution is warranted. I set out to find out the truth, but it\'s difficult and hidden. And of course as usual it\'s complicated. The company would do better if all their products would actually be present on their website and provide honest information about each, but as of Nov \'23 there are only 3 products on the website with zero info. Product Info is rather hidden and spread across several blog posts and it\'s hard to understand what actually applies to what. There is only a couple blog posts where it is said that Carote uses DURIT Granitec HL. This is a non-stick coating made by the Swiss company ILAG (that info is also hidden in blog posts and mentioned by some in the Q&A here.) ILAG is a massive global brand and a leader in the coating industry. After digging on ILAG\'s website I found the PDF for the product https://www.ilag.ch/fileadmin/dateien/Dokumente/Prospekte_Hoch/Broschueren_EN/Cookware/Leaflets/40640_Leaflet_DURIT-GRANITEC-HL_EN.pdf which very clearly states that the Basis is PTFE. So the statement in the image with the Mom and Daughter that the product is PFAS free is false. This could easily just be an honest mistake by some marketing person who confused the facts her/himself (hard to keep it all straight, PFAS, PFOA, PFOS, PTFE etc. ;) But it should never happen and it misleads people thinking they are getting PTFE free cookware, when they don\'t. PFAS is an overarching category for over 9000 chemicals of which PTFE is just one. The really bad PFAS offenders in the Non-Stick market used to be PTFE made with PFOS & PFOA (again, all are PFAS) which have been phased out of the market in 2015, since they had serious health concerns and regulations finally caught up with that fact, so most products nowadays should be be PFOA and PFOS free and most Non-stick products proudly claim that on their packaging/marketing. There are newer chemicals that replaced these 2 for PTFE which have potentially new and unknown health concerns (or not, they could be safe). But Carote claims to have none of those and their product is 100% free of APEO, GenX, PFBS, PFOS, PFOA. ILAG\'s Durit Granitec adheres to stringent European guidelines which all in all makes this a pretty safe PTFE choice.The larger question: how bad is PTFE (broadly known by the brand name Teflon) really? For many people that seems to be an automatic Oh NO and TOXIC etc. It probably gets such a bad rep because it used to be made with PFOA and PFOS and can\'t shake that bad image. Newer formulations like this one from ILAG might actually be totally fine. The claim 100% Non-Toxic (which is also used in Carote\'s marketing) is technically true. PTFE is considered Non-Toxic under normal cooking conditions. And again a lot of the really bad PFAS are not in Carote\'s coating. But if you end up accidentally overheating your pots or pans it can start to break down and release harmful fumes, apart from losing its performance (rather rapidly according to some reviews here) as well. That is the main problem with PTFE based Non-stick. So for me that is a big BUT ;) and ultimately lead me to returning this product, since I have a bad habit of doing that and we have a gas stove where it\'s easy to do.The bottom line is if you want true Non-Stick you are making compromises and taking on a risk of having potentially harmful effects to health in your cookware, regardless which one you choose. They all have their own potential health risks. Many different formulations out there. Some Ceramic can claim PTFE free, but has it\'s own issues and also struggles with longevity. How high that risk is, is hard to say and in many instances still unknown and again everyone has their own risk tolerance. We live in a world where we are surrounded by thousands of chemicals and the majority of PFAS or other harmful substances or metals that end up in humans do not come from our cookware, there are dozens of more concerning pathways. And the risk of them is very real! If you don\'t want to take that risk from your cookware go with Cast Iron, Carbon Steel or Stainless steel and learn how to use those (which is what I\'ll be doing).If you are disciplined and treat this product the right way (no high heat, no dishwasher, no abrasive cleaning, avoid all scratching.) This is probably a good and reasonably healthy non-stick coating and as good as it gets at this price point.Which should be noted as being at the low end for cookware, you can easily spend hundreds and hundreds of $ on higher quality. There\'s also a sea of brands that are very close to identical to Corate that all use the same marketing. It\'s so obviously the same template it\'s silly. Imarku, Sansarte, Michelangelo, Vkoocy, Hausfrau etc. Seems almost endless. So these are either white label brands that not only offer the product, but the marketing package along with it or one big company that is flooding Amazon. Or some other selling scheme on Amazon. Quite annoying that whole trend, everyone\'s a seller these days. So who knows what sort of company you\'re actually dealing with. And if this brand name goes under because mediocre or bad reviews like mine become too prevalent, they just shut it down and start the next one. BUT It doesn\'t necessarily mean the product is junk. It looked and felt nice and sturdy and I was on the brink of keeping it. But due to my overheating concern (and the dodgy marketing annoying me), it\'s not for me. You be the judge!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best pots and pans', 'author': 'Kerri Moran', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We’ve been looking for true non stick pots and pans. A expensive set we had prior to this was nonstick and cooked great until it started peeling the black coating off. Did some research and came across this set on TikTok and after reading some reviews I decided to give them a try! Let me tell you, THE BEST pots and pans I’ve cooked with. They cook beautifully, nothing sticks to them, and cleaning is a breeze! I made my son boxed Mac n cheese one night and left the pot on the stovetop over night. Cleaning the next morning was so easy. Ran under water and the congealed cheese came right off, then I washed with a soft sponge. Highly recommend this set!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: GreenLife Soft Grip Healthy Ceramic Nonstick 16 Piece Kitchen Cookware Pots and Frying Sauce Pans Set, PFAS-Free, Dishwasher Safe, Turquoise
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very lite and easy to clean', 'author': 'JUDSON P ROOKS', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We bought this color in gray and it is very elegant looking. The pots and pans are very easy to clean , they did not stick and and were lightweight yet sturdy. I would prefer a larger saute pan but the one in the set is perfect for smaller meals.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty pans and super non-stick! Nice weight.', 'author': 'A.M.R.L.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We got the lavender set of 16, = 3 pots, 4 pans, 5 lids, 4 low quality utensils that melt if leaned on edge while cooking.To not damage the pans, don’t use on temp higher than medium! You really won’t need to turn the burned over 5 (medium). All cooking temps are about one notch lower than in our old pans. The utensils that are included, Would be great IF they didn’t MELT and/or SNAP in half the second use. It says to use oil or butter every time, you need like a dime sized drop. If you don’t, and something sticks, put a half tsp water in the pan and cover with the lid for 15-30 seconds, it will be unstuck. It’s a whole new slippery game when trying to flip things. Like an egg, you will want a fork to hold it still while you get a spatula under it. The handles are comfortable and the weight of the pans make it easy to toss diced potatoes up and over for flipping. Things cook more evenly in these than my old pans, and clean up is crazy easy. Toss a napkin in the grease, soak it up, wipe clean let the cool!! Then and wash with soft dishrag. We had issues with first shipping because color we ordered was unavailable, but second color choice finally arrived. We are enjoying this lavender color. Even though the coloring varies from pans to pot. The pans are mostly the same pinkish-lavender shade but the big pot is way different shade of pale flat light lavender. One bummer about this set is the lack of a large frying pan, my old set had a big 13 inch frying pan and the largest one in this set is like 10 inches. The tall sides on the largest frying pan are a nice feature.Yesterday I told my S.O. that these pans are my favorite “house needs” purchase that we have made since the vacuum. I give these pans a 4 3/4 stars!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars They are still new but I love these so far!', 'author': 'tay', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So, I haven\'t started using all of these as I cook for one, but what I have used, I love. I bought the 2.5 qt sautepan a few months ago and loved it so much that when the 12 piece set went on sale, I grabbed it. The set pieces were wrapped but weren\'t in it\'s original box inside the shipping box, (not sure what that was). Everything looked new and intact.These cook evenly and with a lower heat than I have previously used, but that keeps things from burning and allows them to cook evenly through. I haven\'t tried to fry crisp fried sliced potatoes and the like because I avoid that much oil. I try to eat healthy and these are perfect for that. Great for veggie and chicken stir fries and the like. Also great for frozen family-sized dinners packages with pasta. I love the 7" egg pan for all kinds of eggs, chicken breasts or burgers for one. I am sure I could do anything easily.I love how solid they are. I love how well the lids fit (solid too) and and you can see through to check the food.I love how all handles are covered with an almost rubbery material that makes them easy to grip and heat free.I love that as soon as I plate the food, I can turn to the sink, empty any leftover food I don\'t want to save, rinse with hot water, add a drop of soap, and use my sponge wand to simply wipe away any oil or minor pieces of food, then rinse, and turn them over to drip dry while I eat. All cleaned up.My only heads up to readers is that I haven\'t had these along time and thus do not know how they will hold up. The metal is thick and the ceramic (?) melded coating seems thick and solid as well. I suppose if I burn stuff too often, fail to get the oil or left over food cleared while washing, or am not careful with the handles, they could wear out sooner rather than later. I hate warped pans or sticky surfaces, but these don\'t seem apt to do that if I follow normal care and correct heat and attention while cooking. I haven\'t used the dishwasher because they are so easy to rinse out.I can\'t believe how solid they are for the sales prices I paid... and I intentionally bought when they were on sale. I have my eye on adding a few more pieces. I just wished more of them could be ordered alone. I keep thinking about buying my daughter-in-law the purple ones for her birthday. I don\'t see that varying colors go on sale though. We\'ll see. That is still aways off. I\'ll take the time to check wear and tear first. :) (She won\'t read this, right? :P )', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars Just don't pour anything with these.", 'author': 'Jose I. Rodriguez-cruz', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I bought these after buying a new gas stove, which I needed since the electricity isn't as reliable as it should be where I live. So, after doing a short search, I happened upon these, which I decided to buy because I own a frying pan from Green Life and I've quite enjoyed using it for the past 5 years. It's held up quite well over that time and I have confidence that this set will hold up well for years to come. At first glance however, they seemed a little flimsier than my frying pan is, with its thick bottom and more robust handle. But this is a $100 set of cookware, so I'm willing to forgive such shortcomings.As for the cooking experience, it's quite good. I've had to get used to cooking with gas again, which hasn't been the easiest thing for me, but these pans take out a lot of the learning curve associated with that. I am so glad to know that the non-stick coating on this works as well as I hoped it would and the variety of this set is very nice. I finally have a large pot to boil lasagna in and every piece has its own lid aside from the frying pans. The added utensils are a nice touch and everything has been really easy to clean and keep looking nice. I waited a while in writing this review because I hadn't cooked rice with it yet. I make a small amount of rice when I cook it, and all I use is water and a pinch of salt. I'm happy to say that after the appropriate cooking time on my gas stove, none of it stuck to the bottom and it came out perfect. I'm happy to have purchased this set and I would recommend it to anyone looking for something nice and cheap. My only real complaint about this set is the design of the saucepans, which absolutely will not let you pour anything liquid from them without spilling. I used to boil milk to make my coffee in the morning, and I can't pour the milk from it into my coffee cup without making a mess. But that's a minor concern and there are other ways to heat up my milk for coffee. Yes, there are certainly better sets of cookware out there, but this was just right for me, only taking away a star because of the slight nature of most of the pans and the fact I can't pour anything from them. But this is a set I'd definitely buy again in a heartbeat!I'll update in 6-12 months to see how these hold up.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 21, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Your Kitchen's New Besties (But not suitable for gas stovetop!)", 'author': 'gkanerva', 'rating': 5, 'content': "As someone who purchased the GreenLife 16 Piece Nonstick Pots and Pans Set as a starter kit in 2021, I can confidently say that it has been a reliable companion in my kitchen for almost three years. When my husband and I moved in together, I was on the lookout for a cohesive cookware set, and the non-stick feature of this set caught my eye, despite some mixed reviews.I'm delighted to report that this set has stood the test of time, remaining almost unscathed throughout years of daily use. The nonstick surface, a critical factor for me, remained effective even after acquiring a few inevitable scratches along the way. It's worth noting that I exclusively used silicone spatulas and avoided any steel utensils to preserve the nonstick coating.Being an avid cook who prepares intricate meals regularly, I've put this set through its paces, and it has kept up with me through three moves. I must emphasize that I washed the pots and pans in the dishwasher after every use and they did not withstand any damage from that! However, the breaking point came when I moved to a new home with a gas stovetop.Unfortunately, the set did not react well to direct heat. While the nonstick surface held up admirably, the bottoms of the pots and pans started to show signs of damage and emitted an unpleasant smell. Understanding that direct heat is notorious for affecting pans with coatings, especially non-stick ones, I decided to part ways with the set.It's important to note that I don't attribute the set's shortcomings to its quality. In fact, it performed well considering the circumstances. Direct heat can be harsh on coated pans, and these held up nicely despite some wear and tear. The major downside was the lingering smell, which prompted me to replace the set with a stainless steel one.In conclusion, the GreenLife 16 Piece Nonstick Pots and Pans Set is an incredible option for its price. It provides everything you need for your kitchen as a wonderful starter set, and if used with proper heat precautions (avoiding direct heat), it can serve you well for a long time.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing!!!', 'author': 'Kathryn', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Have these pans for a while. Was waiting to see if they performed to my standard. First looked at rivet's; looked good, sturdy, liked the color. I was amazed that nothing sticked to them (better than my old telethon pans.). Eggs fly off, watch out! Boiling chicken film a piece of cake to clean. I would highly recommend to anyone who does not lie to scrub pans.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome cookware set!', 'author': 'Tina', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased the smaller set as a Christmas gift for my daughter at first. Since I had to do a return on this item I upgraded to the bigger set. It was reasonably priced, fast delivery! My daughter is very pleased with the set! You barely have to wash anything off the pans. Everything literally glides off! Great all around cooking heat! Best thing for a person who loves to cook daily! Highly recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Wanted to love them', 'author': 'Batwoman', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I recently moved my large family into a camper while we build our house. I did a LOT of research on pots and pans before purchasing these. What do I love? I purchased the yellow set… they are a beautiful muted yellow. They heat quickly and my food doesn’t stick to them (so far). It came with decent cooking utensils. What do I hate? They scratch SO easily. I have them in a cabinet by themselves and they scratch one another on the inside just being stacked together. I don’t even want to call it scratching, because my large pot actually has a chunk out of it. The bottoms were tore up (scratched) after the first use on my camper stove, which is gas, even though I avoided moving them around. The handle on one is burned, even though I cooked on low that time, and the pot was completely over the flame. One of the lids seems to be bent a bit and I have to maneuver it just to get it on a pot. Based off what I read, the set seemed to be able to accommodate cooking for my family of 6, however most of the set is much too small to use to make food for such a large family. This was a huge disappointment. They came with instructions, and I followed them… I only use plastic cooking utensils and medium/low heat when cooking, etc. I was hoping they would be great, so I could purchase another set when we move into our house, but I am just disappointed. I’ll be finding something better quality when the time comes. These are beautiful pans and they distribute heat/clean so nicely! I originally bought the purple set of pots and pans and liked them so well that I quickly went back and bought the large, navy sauté pan. After two uses with the large sauté pan I noticed scratches on the bottom. I didn’t do anything crazy or use sharp metal against the pan or anything like that. I contacted the company and all they said was that they were still safe to use. Don’t get me wrong! I’m glad they’re safe to use despite the scratches. I’m just confused as to why there would be such an emphasis on aesthetic for it to come off so easily. Since then the sauté pan from the original purple set had quite a few dings on the bottom and I’ve only had them for a couple months. They’re still great pans but my goodness do they scratch easily', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful!', 'author': 'PastelByeol', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought these, in September after eyeing them for a year! They need some extra Tlc to make sure they stay nice, such as Handwashing & making sure not to use high heat (definitely suggest cast iron for high heat needs) and these have stayed beautiful! Only issue is the Big pot is clearly a different color, seen some other reviews say the same for the Lavender set, but aside that tiny issue, these are a WONDERFUL set! & I am VERY picky about my colors and quality! Reviews stating this is a bad set Ive noticed do not care for them properly or clearly use high heat on them. I also dont Recommend if you have a Gas stove with live flame as they do have Plastic handles! ✌🏻 my bf did use metal in them once and cause a tiiiny knick, so I also suggest Silicone or wood utensils in these! I don’t usually leave reviews unless Im highly impressed or very very concerned for a product, But, all in all, They are 100% perfect if you dont mind the extra time to care for them properly and really want some bright beautiful pots and pans!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome pots and pans....LOVE THEM!!', 'author': 'TnGranny', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I usually buy only stainless steel, but I am so ooo glad I decided to try these. Use med heat, cook, fry, bake, roast. I made baked pasta with lots of melty cheese, which usually means lots of soaking and scrubbing before dishwasher. Not this time. title: Kitchen Academy Induction Cookware Sets - 12 Piece Cooking Pan Set, Granite Black Nonstick Pots and Pans Set
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Cookware Set for Everyday Cooking!', 'author': 'Daniel', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Kitchen Academy Induction Cookware Sets - 12 Piece Cooking Pan Set in Granite Black, and I am extremely impressed with the quality and performance of these pots and pans. The nonstick coating is fantastic and truly lives up to its claims. I've been using them for a couple of months now, and they still look as good as new, with no signs of wear or scratches.The set includes a variety of sizes, which is perfect for all my cooking needs. The pans heat up quickly and distribute heat evenly, resulting in perfectly cooked meals every time. I love how the handles stay cool to the touch, making it easy to maneuver the pots and pans while cooking.Cleaning these pans is a breeze. The nonstick surface allows for effortless food release, and a simple wipe with a sponge or cloth is all it takes to get them clean. title: T-fal Signature Nonstick Cookware Set 12 Piece Oven Safe 350F Pots and Pans, Dishwasher Safe Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars T-fal Signature Nonstick Cookware Set: A Kitchen Game Changer', 'author': 'James Cumbee', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently acquired the T-fal Signature Nonstick Cookware Set from Amazon, and I can't express how much it has transformed my cooking experience. If you're in search of high-quality cookware that makes every meal a breeze to prepare, look no further.Exceptional Nonstick Surface: The nonstick coating on these pots and pans is truly remarkable. It ensures that nothing sticks, making cooking and cleaning up an absolute pleasure. From eggs to delicate sauces, everything slides effortlessly off the surface.Even Heat Distribution: These pans heat up quickly and evenly, ensuring that every dish I cook turns out perfectly. Whether I'm sautéing, simmering, or searing, I can trust that the heat is distributed consistently.Sturdy and Durable: The build quality of the T-fal Signature set is outstanding. The pots and pans feel robust and sturdy, and I have no doubt they will withstand the test of time in my kitchen.Comfortable Handles: The ergonomic handles are designed with comfort in mind. They stay cool during cooking and provide a secure grip. Even when I'm cooking for extended periods, I never experience discomfort.Versatile Set: This cookware set comes with a variety of pots and pans, each with its own purpose. From the small saucepan for heating sauces to the large sauté pan for one-pot wonders, this set covers all my cooking needs.Easy Cleanup: Thanks to the nonstick surface, cleaning up after cooking is a breeze. A quick wipe with a sponge or cloth, and the pots and pans are ready for their next culinary adventure.Safe to Use: The cookware is PFOA, lead, and cadmium free, which gives me peace of mind knowing that I'm preparing meals with safe and healthy cookware.Great Value: Considering the quality and performance of this cookware set, it's an incredible value for the price. It has elevated my cooking game without breaking the bank.In conclusion, the T-fal Signature Nonstick Cookware Set has become an integral part of my kitchen. It has simplified my cooking routine, allowing me to create delicious dishes with ease and convenience. Whether you're a seasoned chef or a beginner in the kitchen, this set is a five-star investment that will undoubtedly enhance your culinary adventures. I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone looking to upgrade their cookware.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality', 'author': 'Mandi', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These pans are great quality for the price. Sturdy but not heavy. Cook well. Easily cleaned. Love them so far!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No stick video attached- shot with one hand (the other held camera)- no butter or oil used!!', 'author': 'Jeneane Vanderhoof', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. I had T-fal when I got my first apartment- it was given to me as a gift and my first complete set of cookware ever. So when it came time to purchase a new cookware set, I went through Amazon and saw T-fal- for everything you got in the twelve-piece set, and you couldn't beat the price- and I knew it was top-of-the-line cookware (in my opinion), from previous use.Everything I needed was in the set- except for the bigger cooking pot. So I bought my birthday present for myself. And yes, cookware is a gift item, in my opinion, even when bought for the home- because it is so nice. And there was nothing more that I wanted than some good cookware to make my life easier- and nicer- to make better food for my loved ones.Let me tell you about the video I made to illustrate my point- of how T-fal is top of the line, high quality made and no other line can give you what T-fal does, at the price- Please excuse that I had to make the video by myself. And I had no stick to hold my phone- only one hand and the other- and these old hands have nerve damage and problems so know that I tried my best.I mixed an egg and poured it into the bare pan- meaning no butter, no oil, just the egg mixture (which was only eggs beaten in my mixing cup). Watch as I cook it (one-handed, the other videoing), and how nothing sticks, it all came up great-- you can see for yourself how nothing sticks!!And, in the video- look and see that there are no signs of oil, butter, or anything that could help the egg not stick. (And excuse the large scraper- while I could have used the one that came with the set- I figured instead of unpacking it, I'd use the one that we had out). All that is there to help prevent sticking is the wonderfulness of T-fal's non-stick technology. Honestly, it was all amazing- to again cook with T-fal and see the wonders of great heat distribution (which also helps the non-stick), along with the non-stick elements.Had I known what would happen next, I would have kept the video rolling but one-handed and all, I quit as early as I could- not knowing how to edit videos either (yet). But I took the pan to the sink to wash it- all I really needed to do- and did- was take a paper towel and wipe the access off. And then it was sparkling clean- nothing left to wash. The picture I included after the video was the pan after it was wiped out with a paper towel, no other cleaning was needed (or done). Especially since no butter or oil was used. And even though the egg was a little bland without anything to grease the pan- I added a little salt and thought how much better my health would be- without clogging my pores with oil and butter.All the T-fal in the set are that amazing. And while I would add more photos of it- the pan is the smallest of the set that I used- all the others look as they appear online in photographs- you don't really need my extra photos because they look the same at home as they do on Amazon.I think the set I had was great for me when I was younger- because at that time I hadn't mastered cooking in a way that made me want to be patient- cook right- and spend the time doing it. Youth can be that way. This is why this set is great- it makes up for the error of youth and the impatience- because that is normally when you are going to get things that stick to the pan- with that kind of attitude. So if you are looking for anyone's set of first cookware- you have found it.But now I take the time to cook and do it well. Even master complicated dishes that take a long time.- however, I want some good cookware to do this. T-fal is still the best for me. Also- for those health issues I have- I would like to cut out added butter and oil- especially when I use it just for the non-stick element and the recipe would be great, still, without it. As you saw in my video- no butter or oil is needed.I am so happy that T-fal has stayed affordable, and even become more affordable over time. This whole set was an amazing price- I didn't pay more than $10 per item- with all that was included- which is amazing when you look at the quality. A small pan that works this well should see for over $20 on its own.Thanks to T-fal for being such a large part of my life- and making it so much easier with the best cookware ever!Please note: I shot the video with one hand to work on everything, the other was on the camera. Sorry I'm not really set up to make great videos- wish I was but I tried my best to show how great the pan is. Also, the second photo shows it after cooking the eggs in the pan and I used a paper towel to wipe out whatever didn't land in the bowl. What was left- a clean pan needing no further wash!!Addition to Review on 11/13If you watched my video, you see that I used a metal spatula- which isn't the best idea with T-fal. If you want to keep the great results of the pots and pans, use the included plastic spatulas and spoons- While nonstick seems like magic, it needs to be treated well to keep working. I just wanted to add this- so people don't follow my bad example. My husband actually reminded me of this, after seeing the video and chiding me on my bad decision, so I don't ruin our new pots and pans (and my birthday present to myself). Isn't that the reason we keep em' around ;)?", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars decent product, but not great. I'll explain", 'author': 'Kaniki', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I bought the black 12 piece set. I have only cooked with them once so far and made eggs in one and cooked maple flavored sausage links in the other. Here is my impression of them. First, the final impression in short and to the point, then why I felt that way..The cliffnotes (short) version..Nice lids that fit on both, the pots and pans.. decent handles on the pots and pans, but not great.. easy to dent pots and pans.. very very cheap utensils.. Ok for single person, couple, or starter set.. Not great if you have kids (you know that they will get damaged 10 times faster with kids around) or if you like caramelizing things like meats to make gravies to stews.. OK for the price but not worth retail. Non stick works, but dont expect the slide around egg effect like you see on TV.. Made in china..Full, Description version of my review...The 3 utensil pieces (spoon, flipper, etc) do work, but I'll be honest, I have bought some in the past at the dollar tree, that were, yes you guessed it, a dollar, and they were made much better. The ones included do work but are not very strong, nor do I think that they will hold up to much use over time. But hey, you didnt buy this set for the utensils, you bought them for the pans, so what do you expect. they will work fine until you get to the store (or order off the net) to buy better ones.The lids to the set are pretty well made. they have plastic over the handles will keep you from burning your hands if you have to remove the lids and feel like it will hold up OK over time. there is a plastic, or silicone spacer between the handle rivets and the glass so that should help protect the glass from breaking due to the metal up against glass. Also, the lids fit perfectly on both, the fry pans and the pots, so you have a way to cover both without having to worry about splatter.. Just cant do both at the same time obviously.Now for the pots and pans.the handles feel decently made. Not great, but pretty good. On a scale from 1 to 10, 10 being great, i would give the handles a 6.. maybe 7 if i was feeling generous. They feel like they will hold up to normal use with no problem, but dont try to abuse them or you may have problems. and it may not be the handles fault, it may be the pot or pan part itself.The Nonstick coating works good from what I have seen so far. I cooked eggs in one, and did not need to use any butter to keep them from sticking. The eggs did not slide around like you will see them do on TV, but they did not stick either. They came right up with no problem and did not break the yolks either. The sausage links I cooked in the other pan never stuck either. I washed both out and dried them by hand and you could not see any kind of mark like they were ever used. so the coating did not peel at all, nor did cooking the food leave any marks.Now for the bad.. the aluminum that the pots and pans are made from is not extremely durable. When taking them out of the packing, one of the pots hit up against the flat pan, and guess what.. It dented.. Yes, that little hit was all it took. I have other good quality pots and pans with non stick coatings that are made out of aluminum too, and they can get hit 5 times harder and not dent.. The aluminum in these is a bit of a softer aluminum, so you have to watch or expect a lot of dents in your pans. But on the positive side of that, because of they way and type of aluminum that they are made out of, they are also light.. it is kinda like comparing whipped cream cheese to brick cream cheese.. one is much softer and lighter.. that is these.Another downfall, which I was not happy to find out, was that they were made in china. I did a search on amazon for american, or USA made pots and pans.. These were at the top of the list. Obviously I should have checked into it a little more and not trusted amazon to be accurate here, and for that reason, I did keep them, after all, they will work fine for what I want, but just to be clear.. China made, not American!!!One things that I never see that I would like to point out though, especially for first time buyers of non stick cookware. Non stick does have its advantages, like not having to use any kind of grease or oils when cooking, but at the same time, there is one major flaw to non stick coatings.. you can not brown food.. I have heard it as browning, glazing, caramelizing, etc. These cook the food fine, but you know how you take a roast and brown or caramelize a roast so that it gets that nice brown glaze in the bottom which is really good if you plan on making home made gravy, or for flavoring the stock in a roast so the flavor goes into the other foods when you cook a roast.., From what I have seen, any non stick pan i have ever used sucked at giving any kind of that browning or caramelizing. It cooks the food with not problem, but you dont get that bit that makes good flavoring or gravy material. If you plan on it, get a pan that is non stick for that purpose.. then after you do the initial caramelizing of the meat, then put all that in these pots if you want. but that is one major draw back to non stick coatings on cookware.Overall, they are not bad, but not great. They will work fine for a single person, or for a couple. For a decent first set, they are not bad either. If you are someone that gets their pans knocked around a bit (maybe put it in the sink then put stuff on top and clean everything later), then expect to get a lot of dents in these over time. Considering that you get these for under $10 per piece, they are not bad for the price, but i would say average priced for the set. I would not pay anywhere near the retail price for these because they are not worth that much, in my opinion at least. If they were more expensive, i probably would have given a 3 start instead of 4, but I tool price into consideration vs quality when I gave it 4 stars. In the end, it all depends on how you cook as to if these are good for you. Personally, I'll take my old club aluminum pots over these any day of the week.. but that is just my opinion. But also, luckily for me, these are for someone else, not for me, so i dont have to worry about it. :)........................................Update on info about them...according to the manual, they are good for gas, spiral or solid electric, ceramic (radiant) and halogen rangetops.also, the temp rating on them for the oven is.. 350f/175c with plastic handles or stainless steel handles with silicone inserts. 450f/230c for full silicone handles. 500f/260c for handles made completely out of aluminum or stainless steel. cookware with soft touch translucent portions is not oven safe. and never use them in the broiler.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The Ultimate Cookware Set for Every Kitchen!', 'author': 'Atahan D.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The T-fal Signature Nonstick Cookware Set is a game-changer in the kitchen. From the diverse selection of pans to the impeccable non-stick ProGlide interior, cooking and cleaning have never been easier. The Thermo-Spot Technology is ingenious, eliminating any guessing about when the pan is ready. Whether you're sautéing, searing, or simmering, this set guarantees even heat distribution for consistently delightful meals. Plus, the durable design compatible with almost all cooktops and oven safety up to higher degrees adds to its versatility. It is a must-have set for both novice and seasoned chefs. Highly recommended!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So far so good!', 'author': 'Amanda Weisbrod', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I’ve had these pans for about a month now and I really dig them. They’re easy to clean, get the job done, and are affordable. I haven’t put mine through the dishwasher even though they are supposed to be dishwasher safe because I ruined my last set of Cephalon pans that way 😬', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great set!', 'author': 'Rapeseed', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These pans are wonderful. Just great all around. Tops in every category. If you're looking for a great cookware set, look no further. I absolutely recommend these. Very nice!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Heats Up, Cleans Easy', 'author': 'J Mac', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought these pots and pans to use with a cooktop stove. hoping they would live up to previous reviews. I prefer cooking in stainless steel, even though food always sticks to the surface. I never leave stuck-on food to sit in the pan. It is not terribly difficult to clean, even with hot water alone. This set looks nice and shiny. The weight feels durable enough for me. The pans have that magnetic bottom layer expected for induction cookware. It heats up much faster than previously owned ones without it. However, non-stick it is not. The sausage and egg I fried in this small pan stuck like glue right away and started to burn quickly even with an oil coating. (I probably had the heat too high.) What I expect of stainless steel. Overall, I am satisfied with the set and plan to keep it. I'll just try lowering the heat to prevent sticking.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Me encanta', 'author': 'Estefany María', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Las ollas son muy buenas, el tamaño es adecuado, las comidas se cocinan más rápido que con mis antiguos calderos y se lavan mucho más fácil. Trae un instructivo muy claro sobre cómo cuidarse y trae utensilios de plásticos para no rayar la superficie.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good set of pans', 'author': 'Boogieman69', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It’s my second set of these pans. title: Gotham Steel 10 Pc Kitchen Pots and Pans Set Non Stick, Kitchen Cookware Sets, Pot and Pan Set, Pot Set, Space Saving Non Stick Pots and Pan Set with Induction Cookware, Dishwasher Safe, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well when they said non-stick, turns out its true!', 'author': 'mememeT', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So very happy with this purchase!All the "pans" I picked up in the past before this one: The paint scratches off within a week, the non-stick always-sticks, the handle is so hot you cannot handle it when cooking, etc.This one: So far, all promises kept!Shockingly easy to clean, and never need to do more than a swish with a "teflon-save" type scrub sponge (used only to make clean-ups fast, not to remove stuff stuck). We\'ve had all we need since, and far less clutter in the pans bin. The "stacking" thing is great, works as promised, very little time to do it.Not an ounce of "scratched off" paint yet, which is great.Back to cleaning though: Nothing sticks. Wow. Swish around them with appropriate sponge, and/or slide into dishwasher. Every meal we have every size we need, with lids. Lids are flat, and that helps with stacking.Could this have been an ounce more perfect? One silicone handle that fits the handles of all pans, so one doesn\'t "eye that metal handle with suspicion" when cooking... The handles are sturdy, beautiful, but they do get a little hot. I will look for one separately. Other than that, this is the most perfect any pan set purchase could have been for me.Happy!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing', 'author': 'Janice Keith', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm so pleased with the Gotham Steel Pots that I purchased. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect! Would buy again!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are wonderful. I made the pan protectors to avoid scratching when stacked.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent set for smaller amounts of food', 'author': 'Austin Hudson-Lapore', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The nonstick coating is fantastic - incredibly easy to cook and clean with. The rubberized handles are very comfortable. If you're cooking for yourself or maybe one other person, the pots and pans are perfect.However, I do suggest that if you regularly cook for multiple people and you buy this set, get an extra, larger frying pan. The larger of the two that's provided is not really adequate if, say, you're sauteing two whole onions for a full pot of soup, or if you want to make a quesadilla using large tortillas. Because I mostly cook multiple meals' worth of food at a time, I don't use either of the frying pans in the set all that often. I also never find a use for the smallest saucepan.I've also found that the utensils are of somewhat questionable quality. In particular, they don't react too well to heat. I'm not sure if it's from normal use or from one of my roommates frequently leaving it resting on a hot frying pan, but the end of the spatula has some damage from melting or burning, which causes small strips of black plastic to fall off occasionally. And there are several deep gouges in the handle caused by letting it rest on the edge of a hot pan and melting.But the bottom line is that this is a very nice cookware set at a pretty good price. Maybe buy a bigger frying pan and a better spatula to supplement it, and that will basically fix the minor problems it has.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good basic cookware set', 'author': 'Reviewer7', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Basic pots and pans with anti-stick surfaces, able to be used in the oven and cleaned in the dishwasher.
