Haven't noticed anything yet, but something that I'm keeping an eye on.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 10, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Too cheap', 'author': 'ZG', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Rather spend a little bit more of money than buying these cheap ones', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars very good', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'works', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Cook N Home Kitchen Cookware Sets, 12-Piece Basic Stainless Steel Pots and Pans, Silver
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Beautiful, Quality, Durable Cookware Set!', 'author': 'Bake2013', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A dear friend who cooks very well kept mentioning all year that she would love to purchase a cookware set, and was looking for an additional set to add to her cooking/baking schedule. I have been listening to her speak about what type of cookware sets, and mysteriously asked her what brands names does she like, she mentioned brand names as well as the amount of pots she would like in her cookware set. I saw this Cook N Home 12 Piece Stainless Steel Set on the Amazon website, and I thought for the quality, style and discounted price, this would make an excellent gift.I viewed different types of cookware available during the holiday season. I was surprised by the different sizes, prices, variety, and quality of these sets. I decided to purchase this Cook N Home 12-Piece Stainless Steel Set. I was concerned that since the price was discounted, would the quality of this cookware be durable enough for the type of food she wanted to cook in this set. I know that food can sometimes be compromised because the pots are not durable enough to cook the food while maintaining the taste of the menu/recipe in the final results of cooking.I was concerned about whether the food would taste great in this cookware set based on the price. I started to ask her about different cookware brands, she mentioned a few manufacturer brand names she previously knew, as well as brands she saw on the Amazon website that she was interested in purchasing.I ordered this set for her as a Christmas gift, she was extremely surprised, appreciative, and her family thought that it was a great gift, and gesture on my part to give her something that was needed, appreciated, and of great quality. She did wait until Christmas to open the gift, although she is someone who loves to open gifts early. I would and she would definitely recommend this cookware set to others, as well as Amazon Customers who are looking for a quality, durable, and reasonably priced stainless steel cookware set. This set is efficient for all your cooking needs. She stated that it was packed neatly/securely, and delivery was timely. When it arrived, she did not know what it could be and wanted to guess what I could have purchased for her, coming up to the time of Christmas Day, she promised she would not open the gift until Christmas, although guessing everyday what could it be inside the large box.She was extremely surprised; her family appreciated the gift since they would benefit from more varieties as cookware would not be an issue to receive more selective dishes at mealtime. She is very happy with this gift, and appreciates that I was listening all year as she kept stating that she wanted another cookware set. She likes the fact that it looks much better than she could have anticipated, definitely a quality stainless steel cookware set, cooks nicely whether frying, steaming, stewing, or using to bake some meals, and very easy to wash. It has mirror polished stainless steel, inside and outside, capsulated bottom for even heat distribution, suitable for all cooking source electric, gas stove, or glass and ceramic, capsuled bottom with aluminum disc inside for even heating, stainless handle rivet to provide durability, and tempered glass lids for clear viewing while cooking.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars They seemed to be made rather cheaply but the quality is much better than perceived.', 'author': 'Noel W.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've had this pot and pan set for awhile now and the quality is a lot better than it seems. I purchased them specifically to use with my induction cooktops and I use them on a daily basis. They work very well and are quite a bit more durable than they appear to be. Well worth the purchase price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very impressive quality', 'author': 'rju', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is my 2nd time purchasing the same set . I bought it back in 2016 and now replacing with the same set. For my daily cooking needs this set is very useful. I use it for preparing rice, curry and Tea and to boil milk for making curd. And many more dishes..', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great little set of pans', 'author': 'Sue', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I\'ve had a set of pans for almost 30 years and loved them. As my hands have gotten older and have some issues I\'d been searching for lighter weight pans with double handles. They are not easy to find! Finally came across these. Very reasonable priced. Cooking in them is good and the sizes are better for us at this point. Cleaning them is easy and do they do well in the dishwasher too. If something looks like it will be a little harder to clean I put a little water in them and heat it a few minutes then there\'s no problem. For me there are 2 cons... I don\'t care for the way the handles are attached having the "buttons" on the inside makes it so you can\'t stir smoothly around the sides. In all fairness I haven\'t found any double handle pans that don\'t have the handles attached like that no matter how expensive. Without the long handles the pans take up way LESS space and stack great! Now my biggest pet peeve...The edge of the pan is curled under but not smooth so it creates a wonderful spot for water to sit in after you\'ve washed so when you pick up a pan water goes all over you and the floor. The handles stay cool and I don\'t need an oven mitt to handle them BUT the handles are hollow and not sealed so they can have quite a bit of water in them too. Let\'s just say I\'ve had to dry the floor more than once! Would I buy them again...Yes...I needed this type of pan with double handles they work very nicely on a glass top stove and are good sizes for us. Other than the water issue these are a great set of pans. In the last two pictures I\'m trying to show where the water stays in waiting to get you.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality', 'author': 'Ladyhawke', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Excellent set for the price & be sure to use Barkeepers Friend Stainless Pots & Pans cleanser bc it does a great job without scratching. Leaves Pans shiny & spotless after every use. Stainless steel products need to be cleaned after every use to maintain the product and quality.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great stainless steel pans', 'author': 'Marion Beverly', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'If you know how to use stainless steel pans, they are the best to cook with. Love them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars 2 Years Later: A Bargain But Not a Steal', 'author': 'Anna Reed', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I bought these pans 2 years ago, and they still work just fine! Overall this is a pretty good deal for how cheap they are. I\'m thinking it\'s time for an upgrade, however. I am an avid home cook, and in addition to this set I use a variety of frying pans.The first thing I need to say is this: if you have not used stainless steel and are used to non-stick, you have some learning to do! Do your research and learn how to use your cookware. The biggest things to remember: preheat your pan before adding food and use plenty of oil. If your meat sticks, that\'s a good thing; just wait until it releases on its own to move it around the pan. Later you can add some liquid (water, wine, vinegar, stock, etc.) to deglaze or release all of the lovely flavorful browned bits on the bottom of the pan. If you are a novice, I would recommend that you continue to use non-stick for delicate foods like eggs and fish.Now that that\'s out of the way, let\'s get to the review.UseabilityThese pots will boil water! Perfect for making pasta, ramen, and anything with copious amounts of liquid. The bottoms have a tendency to scorch when there isn\'t as much water present, so you\'ll want to stir frequently. I\'ve made fudge, caramel, and toffee in that dutch oven, and it only scorched at the very end. I\'m used to this, and it just means that I can\'t scrape the bottom.The frying pan has deep walls, so it will trap moisture and cause less evaporation than a pan with lower, sloping sides. I don\'t use this one very often, opting instead for non-stick (for ease of use and of clean-up), carbon steel, or cast iron. Again, these pans don\'t fare so well in a low-moisture setting.The handles are odd. Typically with the two-handled pots, one handle will get hot and one will stay cool during the cooking process, and that\'s if I use the correct burner size.The lids have vents, but they still rattle loudly when your water comes to a boil. It kind of works as an alarm so that I know the water is boiling - like the whistle of a tea kettle.DurabilityThe casserole/dutch oven type pans are what I use the most, like one would use a sauce pan. Those have held up really well, and with a little bit of Barkeeper\'s Friend would look brand new. These are lightweight and probably won\'t take much of a beating, but with normal use they will last just fine. I haven\'t had any lids break on me, either.The fry pan, however, has a warped bottom. Within a few months or so, the encapsulated bottom formed a 2-inch bubble, so it doesn\'t sit flat on the stove top.The handles are hollow, but I haven\'t had problems with strength. None of them have bent or buckled.Clean-UpFood comes off of these just fine, although sometimes they require a good soak. We have hard water, so spots are inevitable, and sometimes the "rainbow" effect is too, but with some Barkeeper\'s Friend they shine like new. My roommate blackened the entire bottom of the frying pan, and I anticipate that it will scrub away just fine, because that powder is magical.The hollow handles like to collect water, so I make sure to let my pans dry thoroughly before hanging them back on my wall.The Bottom LineIf you\'re a casual home cook, a broke college student, or just someone who needs to boil water, I highly recommend this set. It\'s cheap and it works. If you have more money to spend and are looking for quality cookware, you should probably go for something else, but it\'s hard to be disappointed by a $45 set of pans.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 10, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Say Goodbye and Good Riddance to Non-Stick Coating Forever', 'author': 'NLT of NM', 'rating': 5, 'content': "For my health, I decided to get rid of non-stick and plastic. I've been buying cast iron because I know it is very safe. Piece by piece, I've bought all the cast iron basics. And I have some Pyrex for baking. Feel clueless about stainless steel? Well, I sure was. I bought a couple pieces from a second-hand shop and sent all my food to its doom. I was left with very unappealing cookware that has been buried somewhere. I'm not sure where to look, but they can stay buried.Well, I couldn't stay a chicken forever because I'm sure my hair was growing white feathers instead of gray hair. Stainless steel looks very pretty, like something I want to eat off of every day. So I began to look at stainless steel cookware sets on amazon. Then I was ogling stainless steel in youtube videos and cooking videos. Daily, I clucked and pecked at my wish list with indecision because I really didn't want to spend a lot of money for a whole set of stainless steel I'd have to find a new burial place for. This set has only one frying pan, which is exactly what I wanted. Many sets I looked at had multiple pans, but I wasn't looking to replace my cast iron skillets, just add to my cookware choices. I also like the handles on the lids more than the sets with knobs. Easier to grasp with a potholder I think. With the winter weather and holiday season coming up, I enjoy cooking and baking more, so the time had come to do something about my lack of stainless steel. I purchased this set with a hesitant sigh of relief.When the set arrived, I inspected each piece closely before washing. Some of the pieces had very minor dents. I think I only noticed them because I was so anxious, scared, excited - glowing. I had a friend here while I un-boxed, because of course, I had to show off my shopping skills just a little bit.I earnestly began to plan my whole life and diet around testing this cookware. A twelve-piece set cannot be tested sufficiently in an hour or two. I poached eggs, cooked rice, fried chicken, Italian sausage, made berry sauce, cooked dried beans, cooked bacon, fried eggs, made soup, heated frozen vegetables, and cooked pasta. I learned how to clean this cookware immediately after cooking and after letting sit overnight. I developed a fondness for this set that's almost as intense as my feelings for my cast iron. Yes, I'm very attached to my cast iron because of all the time and energy I've put into getting them seasoned just right - including not letting anyone else touch them. I hand clean my new set just as carefully, with hot water, salt, and baking soda. Then I carefully dry each piece by hand - I don't think they will rust from air drying, but they don't gleam as well through water spots.When I buy a double boiler and stainless steel cookie sheets, this new cookware journey will be complete. For now, I'm smiling widely because my stainless steel is beautiful to look at - I didn't ruin any of the pieces. I also didn't burn any of my food because the quality of this set practically guaranteed I wouldn't fail. I know some people think cast iron and stainless steel are hard to maintain, but that's just myth. When used and cleaned properly, the maintenance is a breeze. The alternative, using non-stick is no longer an option for me. I've turned that corner and don't regret it. I have had a lot more fun using this stainless steel set than I could have imagined. It weighs less than my cast iron, so that is a plus when I'm tired or sick. Food cooked in my stainless steel is just as mouthwatering to see as my cast iron. Don't make the mistake to rush the cooking - with cast iron and stainless steel, that is a mistake.When it comes to cleaning, remember that hot water is a friend. No need to spend a lot of energy scrubbing when the hot water will do the heavy lifting.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Gift', 'author': 'Sugar66', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I brought these pots for a gift for my daughter and she loves them. They're just the right size and everything she needed in a cookware.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Durability', 'author': 'manuel ortiz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this purchase great quality', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Cuisinart 11-Piece Cookware Set, Chef's Classic Stainless Steel Collection 77-11G
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cuisinart 11-Piece Cookware Set', 'author': 'Zach', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently made the switch from non-stick cookware to stainless steel due to concerns about potential health risks associated with non-stick surfaces. After researching various options, I decided to invest in the Cuisinart 11-Piece Cookware Set, and I must say, I am thoroughly impressed.One of the standout features of this cookware set is its exceptional heat distribution. Compared to my old pans, I noticed a significant improvement in how evenly heat was distributed throughout the cooking surface. I experimented by heating the middle of the pan while placing the food to the side, and the results were outstanding. This even heat distribution allowed for precise cooking and eliminated hot spots, ensuring that my dishes cooked uniformly every time.Cleaning these stainless steel pots and pans was also a breeze. I had expected it to be a bit more challenging, but to my surprise, a simple combination of water and dish soap was all it took to scrape off any food residue and restore them to their pristine condition. This ease of cleaning has made cooking and cleanup much more efficient, saving me time and effort in the kitchen.Aside from their functionality, I am also impressed by the aesthetic appeal of this cookware set. The simple yet elegant stainless steel design adds a touch of class to my kitchen. There's something timeless and sophisticated about the look of stainless steel cookware that I find appealing, and this set perfectly embodies that.Overall, I couldn't be happier with my purchase of the Cuisinart 11-Piece Cookware Set. Not only does it meet my cooking needs with its excellent heat distribution and easy cleanup, but it also adds a stylish element to my kitchen. If you're considering making the switch to stainless steel cookware, I highly recommend giving this set a try. It's a worthwhile investment that delivers on both performance and aesthetics.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Great Set of Cookware', 'author': 'Grammy05', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Let me preface this review with the fact that I am Italian and raised 5 children on daily home-cooked meals. The kitchen is the center of my home. So when my daughter got her own apartment out west and asked for a set of pots for Christmas, I wanted to make sure I got her a quality set that would last her for years and years. I knew what I wanted for her, but didn\'t know which brand to purchase. Non-stick was out (I have never liked it). The pots also had to be both dishwasher/oven safe, and I wanted the pot handles to be riveted into the pot. Off I went to the mall with my "specifications" in hand to look at the different brands and sets available. Boy was I amazed at how many there were! I took my time and examined each set. Not only did I look at the sets, but I also handled the sets. This is VERY important. Many of the quality sets were so heavy that I needed two hands to lift the larger pieces, and although I could lift the smaller saucepans, I had difficulty tilting them to the side to pour. Others had handles that were very uncomfortable to use. Then I came upon the Cuisinart Chef\'s Classic Stainless 10-piece cookware set. I was very impressed by the quality. They were heavy grade yet easy to handle. They also met my other specifications listed above AND they looked really nice as well. The price of $149 was quite unbelievable. I drove home and ran straight to my computer and ordered the set through Amazon. I got free shipping and had the set delivered directly to my daughter. I also used the holiday bonus coupon for $25 off my order. I was so impressed with the set and the deal Amazon was offering, a few days later I purchased a second set through Amazon for myself. I LOVE them. They cook beautifully on my gas range and clean up well in the dishwasher. The handles DO NOT get hot while cooking, which totally surprised me. Do be careful with the lid handles though. They will get hot if cooking on higher heat. I haven\'t had a problem with delicate foods burning due to the high thermoconductivity of the pans; however, my stove is a professional grade 6-burner unit. I don\'t know if that makes any difference or not. All I can say is this set looks great, cooks great, handles great, and sells at a great price. What more can you ask for?', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2005', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very happy with this set', 'author': 'Kevin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had some older non-stick pans leftover from college, but the non-stick coating was starting to flake off, so it was time for new pans. I really like cooking, so I wanted something that was good quality and would last a long time. Since I was replacing most of my pans, going with a set was the best value for my money. I read lots of reviews about different types of cookware and different brands and finally settled on this set. This is a very good quality set for a great price.As of this review, I have been using this set for 2 months, so I am not able to comment on the long term use of the set. However, everything seems solidly constructed and if properly cared for, I think the set can last a long time. This set had everything that I was looking for. It would be nice if the set included a larger (12") skillet, but I already owned a 12" stainless steel skillet that I bought by itself, so it ended up working out for me.If you are used to other types of cookware, especially non-stick, you have to get used to cooking with lower heat and properly prepping the pan so that things don\'t stick. Heat the pan first, then add some oil to coat the bottom of the pan, allow the oil to heat up, then add the food. I have cooked a good variety of foods with this set and have had good results. As always, sometimes things get messed up when cooking, but I am going to blame that on the cook and not the pans. I have successfully cooked fish and eggs (although I typically use my cast iron for eggs) in these pans without sticking. For fish, making sure that the pan and oil is hot enough will allow the fish to slide and not stick when you put it in the pan. A light layer of flour on the fish can also help. Contrary to what many people say about leaving the food alone and that it will release from the pan on its own, for fish I move the pan around to keep the fish sliding for the first 10-15 seconds to allow it to develop a crust, then I leave it alone. No sticking (Alton Brown taught me this [...]). On the other hand, for cooking some things, you want some little bits to stick to the pan, and you can accomplish that too.I don\'t have a dishwasher, so I have only hand washed these pans. I use just dish soap and a sponge most of the time, but every one in a while I use Bar Keeper\'s Friend to clean them up and help keep them shiny. The pans are all still shiny. You can see some tiny scratches on the bottom when you tilt them the right way in the light, but in no way is the integrity of the pan damaged. If you expect these pans to never get a single scratch and maintain a perfect mirror finish, then take them out of the box, hang them up, and never use them. From use and cleaning, the surface of the pans will get some micro scratches, but these in no way affect how the pans work. To make cleanup easier, run some hot water in the warm pan after cooking to wash out what you can and let it soak for a little if there is anything stuck in the pan. Don\'t run cold water into a hot pan and let the pan cool a little bit before running water in it, otherwise you could damage the pan by rapidly changing the temperature. Also, don\'t leave water sitting in the pan for long periods of time. Let it soak for a while if you need to and then clean up the pan. I usually let them air dry for a little, then wipe them down with a towel and hang them back up.The metal lids fit very well with the pans, but because of the way they are shaped, you are not able to cover anything other than the pans (i.e. a plate) like you could with a glass lid. The lids work great for what they were designed for, so I can\'t fault them for that. Be careful, the lids can get hot if you cover a hot pan with them, so make sure you use a pot holder or towel. Because the lids don\'t have a lip that lets you hang them, I grabbed some S hooks from the hardware store and hang them by the handle. I\'m limited on cabinet space, so I have to hang all of my pans and lids, but I also think it is nice because keeps them from banging into each other.The handles for the pans, on the other hand stay cool enough that you can grab with your bare hand (just don\'t grab it close to where it connects to the pan). It is always good to be safe and test the handle first before grabbing, just to make sure. I have had times where the handle was too close to another pot on my small stove and did get hot.The last thing I love about these pans is the lip around the edge. Pouring liquids from these is just amazing. The liquid funnels down to a single point, making it easy to control, and there is no dripping or splashing.I highly recommend this set to anyone looking for a good deal on a set of quality pans.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars I am pleased with the appearance and performance', 'author': 'M on Amazon', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'People are too unaccustomed to non-stick style pans. When you choose stainless steel cookware you will need to learn how to cook and clean using stainless steel cookware. If you are an old dog who has trouble learning new tricks stainless steel is not for you.These work great with my gas stove. YMMV. I am used to Anolon non-stick costing 2x+ more than this yet for the price this Cuisinart stainless steel set is pretty nice. I took advantage of the sale on this set which includes the steamer. Cuisinart is discontinuing the steamer piece and is selling off the new old stock. The same set absent the steamer is being sold at a close price. I will never use the steamer but I saved a few dollars getting the set with it and the this set came with clear see-through lids instead of metal.Pros: Beautiful finish, comfortable and balanced long handles on the frying pans, even heat distribution (using gas), easy cleaning, also I like the vibe of chrome and stainless steel cookware on the stove instead of the dark gunmetal of Anolon. I was a huge fan of Anolon for years. ALL non-stick eventually wears out and sticks and you have to replace them. Now I prefer stainless steel. I read how to cook using stainless steel and so far I have have near perfect results of no sticking.Cons: The handles and the glass of the lids get hot and stay hot for a longer time than I expected and am used to. There is more play to slide around and they don\'t feel as well made compared to the 2x+ $ Anolon, again at half the cost of the Anolon I am just mentioning it not complaining.Tip: I read that to clean off stuck on food pour white vinegar and some water in the pan and bring it to a boil. IT WORKS! The first time using the frying pan I fried potatoes and there was some food that easily came off when I boiled water and vinegar in the pan. For actual "stains" use Bar Keepers Friend and a non-scratch cleaning pad after the vinegar treatment. They return to new-like condition.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality', 'author': 'T. Barrett', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are very nice, I was impressed for the price. You definitely need to grease/oil the pan to prevent sticking. They aren't non-stick, but I knew that. The whole reason I purchased these was because I didn't want to go back with non-stick due to chemicals leaching into food.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Decade of Culinary Excellence!', 'author': 'Wine_Coffee_Cookie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I purchased this cookware set back in 2012, and I can confidently say it has stood the test of time! Even after a decade of daily use, this set continues to exceed my expectations.Durability: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐The durability of this cookware is truly impressive. Regularly, I go from stove top to oven to serving!Ease of Cleaning: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐Cleaning is a breeze with this cookware set. A little Bar Keeper's Friend and hot water are all it takes to make them shine like new. No stubborn stains or residue, even after cooking messy recipes. The non-stick surface is a game-changer when it comes to quick and easy cleanup.Versatility: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐I love how versatile these pots and pans are. They work flawlessly on any cooking surface, from gas to electric to induction. The consistent heat distribution ensures that every dish turns out perfectly, making my daily cooking routine a joy.Overall Impression: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐After a decade of use, I can confidently say that this cookware set is an investment that pays off. Its longevity, ease of cleaning, and versatility make it a standout choice. Whether you're a seasoned chef or a home cook, this set is a reliable companion in the kitchen. I'm actually buying another set for our daughter in her new house. Highly recommended!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Cookware at Resonable Price!', 'author': 'J. T. Hwang', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've purchased two sets about six months ago and had a chance to use every piece. I have to say that this set is a bargain, but noticed that Cuisinart Multiclad Pro is what I would prefer over this set (if money was no object). I've purchased the Multiclad Pro 3 qt saucepan and the 5-1/2 qt pan to compliment this set, and love the true triple ply and heavier gauge sides which prevents scorching. Can't compare this set to the Cuisinart Multiclad Pro set that cost two to three times as much (or All-Clad)...and I'm quite happy that I have purchased this set!As for the 10-piece set, I agree with the high praise from many already posted. This is a very good set for a resonable price. Would it last a lifetime? Probably not but I will get good use out of it for at least ten years. Sides of pan are a bit thin and will flex slightly (compared to the Multiclad models). If the pan fell from my hanging rack, it would probably dent. You can hang the pots with lids on, though one would have to be careful not to knock them off. One of the lids came off and hit the countertop then the floor, but survived the fall without any damage. My favorite is the 3 qt saucepan and the 3-1/2 qt saute.Cameo or Bar Keepers Friend does a good job of cleaning up residue that can't be cleaned up with standard dish washing soap or in the dishwasher. I have some pitting on the interior of pan from throwing salt from soft-boiling eggs or pasta. Pitting does not impact the performance, but a bit ugly looking (doesn't bother me as this set was inexpensive and I've purchased to use everyday). I've done a comparison between the 3 qt provided in this set compared to the Multiclad 3 qt. I was surprised that using same amount of water an at same size gas burners with switching the pans every minute to ensure even heating, Chef's Classic boiled water quicker than the Multiclad by at least a minute (I'm a professional engineer and a bit quirky that way).I've also purchased the anodized non-stick pans by Cuisinart and been using the glass lids from that set on the Chef's Classic. Since purchasing the stainless set, my non-stick pans are in storage and though they are fairly new, teflon started coming off from the top of the cookware where lid meets the pan. I realize the professionals use metal lids as it keeps in the heat better and easier to clean, but I do like to see what's going on inside the cookware when I'm cooking. I'm starting to get used to the metal lids. This set has also retired my Lodge cast iron cookware to use only on the grill, as the stainless base heat retention is great and much easier to clean and maintain.I would highly recommend this set to anyone who wants a long lasting cookware, likes to use metal utensils with their cookware as long as they don't mind superficial scratches(instruction manual states that non-metallic utensils be used), enjoys developing fond (brown bits) for making tasty sauces, or simply wants a cookware that one can abuse without having to worry about ingesting Teflon, this set would be very satisfactory. If you want the absolute best and spend considerable time in the kitchen, spend more for the Cuisinart Multiclad or All-Clad and don't complain about the little details. For most everyone else out there, this set would be quite adequate. Happy cooking!Other Info: As for interchangeability with Cuisinart Multiclad line, 3-qt line has different size lids as Multiclas line has deeper Saute pans. Frying pans are the same size. Pam or similar cooking spray should be avoided as they will bake on to the pans and will be difficult to remove. I've started to cook eggs on real butter mixed with olive oil. Wow! Eggs are so much better than cooked on the non-stick skillet with spray oil. Everything in moderation, but I've been learning to live a little and exercise more to make up.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2010', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome and even heating.', 'author': 'Boozer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have always LOVED stainless steel cookware! I am afraid of nonstick coated cookware. I always feel uncomfortable using cookware with a nonstick coating.Stainless steel is actually very easy to clean!Yes, I mean that sincerely!I already know the trick to cleaning these.Heat them back up. Add some water and dish soap while it’s on the stove. When it’s hot enough, put some cooler water in and stir with a brush. Everything comes off and the pan looks great again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Quality!', 'author': 'MMP', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I waited a while to review this because I wanted to do my homework and test it out to give this my honest opinion. We have been looking for a long time for stainless steel cookware, and saw this. We have always been Cuisinart fans for their product reliability and durability, and let me tell you, this did not disappoint!First of all, it was packaged so securely that there were no issues with damages upon arrival. I spread out the beautiful set on my table and stepped back to admire it.Then the real test came. I watched YouTube videos on care of stainless steel cookware which helped me a lot. I learned the trick of preheating the pan being used on medium heat. I did 2 minutes, and then I sprayed water using my misting bottle and saw the little water bubbles dance around the pan so I knew it was nonstick ready. And, sure enough, the food cooked beautifully, and slid right out of the pan once finished. Clean up was a breeze!I am a review reader and did read some comments about it not being nonstick and difficult to clean. But, I truly believe that doing the preheat test I described above would have changed their outcomes. I would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone, and look forward to many years of fine service. Bon Appetit!Thank you Cuisinart!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Wishing these had "Heat Resistant" Handles', 'author': 'Joe P.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I purchased this set for my wife. She also loves the fact that there are measuring markers on the inside of the pots.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Granitestone Blue Pots and Pans Set Nonstick, 6 Stackable Piece Cooking Pots Set, Kitchen Pots, Non Stick Coating, 5qt 3qt & 1.5qt Pots with Lids, Stay Cool Handles Dishwasher Safe 100% Toxin Free
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best pans', 'author': 'Nicole Bomar', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was needing some new stock pots and came across these. I have never bought them before but so glad I chose them. They stack inside each other which is great for people with small cabinets or limited space. title: NutriChef 12-Piece Nonstick Kitchen Cookware Set - Professional Hard Anodized Home Kitchen Ware Pots and Pan Set, Includes Saucepan, Frying Pans, Cooking Pots, Dutch Oven Pot, Lids, Utensil -
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to wash... teen son approved. (Dishes is his chore)', 'author': 'Rahani', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Much needed pots and pans set for the New Years! I bought them weeks before Christmas as a gift to our family! Having teens in the house really destroyed my last non stick set and it was getting pretty difficult to cook without food sticking to them, not to mention trying to wash all the food stuck to them after... we were ready for something new! Shopped around for awhile many sites charge shipping to Hawaii so my only option was Amazon where I found this set! I liked the gray tone and it had all necessary pieces we needed according to the picture!Arrived in a store quality box, packaged well to ensure no damage during shipment.Has all the sizes my family needs from individual size cooking to family size meals!The quality is similar to other brand name pots and pans I’ve owned. Except these have different feelings handles!! It has thick rubbery silicone heat resistant handles. My prior one had some kind of thick plastic handles! These handles are very comfortable to grip while cooking! They did not heat up while boiling spaghetti noodles (See video) I was able to drain the noodles into a strainer without holding it with a kitchen rag!Pots and pans are very lightweight yet strong and nice!! The gray tone really looks nicewith my other gray kitchen necessities!The non stick feels really good while cooking, sauté vegetables was so easy and it slid right off on to the plate! I’m hoping the non stick it’ll last long!!They are very easy to wash, my son who’s chores is the dishes no longer has to soak them over night to remove any stuck on food. He appreciates having these wash so easily!! Well... he’s a teen .. they hate doing dishes to begin with!!! We do not own a dishwasher so I can’t comment on how well it will wash in those but I’m sure it would do great!We’ve been using them daily for well over a month to cook our meals and they are working wonderfully!! I’ve taught my kids how to properly cook with silicone or rubber utensils provided in the set to protect the non stick coating and also how to clean these with a soft sponge so they don’t scratch them up! So far so good!!This is the first pots and pans set I ever bought online and I’m very much satisfied with them.... if anything shall change in the future I’ll be sure to update but as of yet these are wonderful!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pans and EXCELLENT customer service.', 'author': 'Happy as a Lark', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Customer Service is GREAT! Got the pans in 2 day’s and they look fantastic. Good quality pots and pans. Nice weight to them, and no warping. I did have a lid that didn’t fit on the cook pot so I sent a text to the founders phone number that is enclosed in the packaging. I got a response back within 2 minutes. I sent a picture of the pot and lid and a new lid was sent out right away and I had it a week later. Even with COVID-19 and all the restrictions and mail being slow I felt I was well taken care of. If you are looking for some great pots and pans at a very good price, I recommend this set! Don’t waste your money on those “high end” brands out there, over priced and cheaply made. Buy Nutrichef and you won’t be disappointed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 15, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cookware', 'author': 'E. M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was a gift to my daughter and she loves it. She said it’s perfect and easy to cook with also easy to clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars One lid didn’t fit......', 'author': 'Monica', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These pots are perfect, I have cooked with them for breakfast lunch and dinner a few times each. I they are easy to use and easy to clean. The handles are very sturdy. Not to mention the awesome design. Nutrichef has beautiful cookware, I want to get another set I see on their website, but I must refrain :). I am giving them 4 stars because one of the lids didn’t fit on the pot. I HATE the headache of return/exchange things. However customer service seems to be looking into it to fix the problem and is VERY kind. The quality of my new set of pots makes up for the headache and (pending resolution) I would purchase this again and recommend them to friends.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 27, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love the pans.', 'author': 'Paige Ross', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very easy to clean! Great price. They were a little smaller than I expected, but work very well. They heat very evenly', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good value for the $$..', 'author': 'kevin morrill', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love the set.For the $$ paid well worth it..Nothing bad to say about this pan/ pot set...Very happy with the product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great product and design', 'author': 'Fernando Moscoso', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My wife loves this set of cookware, is durable, perfect size and looks good in the kitchen', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Factory Defects - NutriChef 12-Piece Nonstick Kitchen Cookware Set', 'author': 'MrBill', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I really wanted to like this set and I probably would have if it wasn\'t for all the factory defects.All 3 pots and the lg fry pan are damaged - 4/6 items damaged (total of 5 defects). 3.4 qt pot - very out of round, lid won\'t fit (pic on review). 2.0 qt pot - out of round, lid won\'t fit (didn\'t notice until I was boxing it all up to return). 1.5 qt pot - nonstick was under sprayed, bare metal (pic on review). 11" Fry pan - damaged cooking surface before nonstick applied, spatula catches on it (pic on review). Plus, weld splatter (looks like) along edge. All are factory defects, not shipping.I tried to show pics of each major defect. I\'m very disappointed. This could be a nice set. But these sets are either factory defects intentionally sold at a slight discount (without notifying customers) OR there is no quality control at the factory OR the company doesn\'t care if they sell defective items. Either way, with 66% of pot & pans defective it\'s not worth trying a second time and end-up being out another return shipping fee and even longer wait. If the factory had good qc to eliminate defective product getting to the customers I believe this would be an excellent cookware set. BUT as is, it isn\'t. Pros = Nice nonstick, Good fairly heavy weight, Thick hard anodized aluminum, Oven safe, Nice handles on pots & lids Cons = Doesn\'t stack very well for storage, Poor quality control with 66% of pots & pans have major defects.I would not recommend this to friends or especially not as a gift. Odds of getting a good quality set is worse than a coin flip. Not worth the risk (for me). But good luck to anyone willing to chance it. UPDATE: NutriChef customer service contacted me. They have, very quickly, refunded the entire purchase price, through PayPal so I had to create a PayPal account (that I didn\'t want). And they are sending me replacement pcs. Without me having to pay return shipping.NutriChef does seem to care about customer satisfaction or at least not having bad reviews.I will update this review again after I receive the new replacements and have a chance to try them. UPDATE #2: I have received the new replacement set. Two pots are (very) slightly out of round but the lids still fit so not a big deal. The non-stick works well so far but I haven\'t tried the true test of scrambled eggs yet (will let you know).The customer service guy was a pain and seemed more interested in not having a bad review than actually having a good product, but he did refund the purchase price and sent a replacement set. So all is good. Was a one star review but since customer service has taken care of issues I changed it to three stars. Would\'ve been four stars except First set was unusable and the customer service rep should be transferred to a different dept.UPDATE #3: I\'ve had a chance to use all the cookware for several diff types of cooking. I have to say.... I\'m very pleased. One of the best non-stick tests are scrambled eggs. Now my cookware is still new condition, but I\'ve cooked scrambled eggs & crepes without any oil or butter and they didn\'t stick at all. Even the crepes slid right out of the pan.** Would be 5 star review but.... * 4/6 pcs in first set had major factory defects. * Had to create PayPal account to get money back. * Customer Support guy was rude, pushy and kinda hateful. * 2 + weeks to get replacement pcs.But all has been taken care of and I\'m now very pleased with cookware.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 3, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars cook great', 'author': 'juan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'cool graet', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price', 'author': 'Joe S.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "It's a great set. One lid doesn't really cover well, has a gap and is a bit out of shape. Otherwise it's ok.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

I’ve used more iterations of frying pans than Georgia has peaches🤣…Well maybe not that many?Onto the review: This Granitestone griddle pan is the bomb!I tried it out this morning with an Eggbeater omelette on a sourdough English muffin, all in the same pan finding ample space. I’m about as far from being a competent cook as you’ll find but this griddle pan made me feel like a semi pro and that’s saying something!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Initial impressions are good!', 'author': 'Brandon', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Product arrived safe with no dents or warps. The eggs came off with a little effort but nothing really stuck on.Heat dispersion seems good on that pan, hope the rest follow suit. No funky taste on the eggs or smell from the pan. Overall a really good start for an affordable set!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice pan for French toast!!!!', 'author': 'Lorie Davis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect Pan to make French toast on!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It works but not the ultimate pan', 'author': 'Mike from Manville', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'What I like about this grill pan is I can use metal utensils and so far, I\'ve not damaged this pan. I also like that the handle is round and hollow which is why it stays cool to the touch... The exterior looks to be a Black anodized finish and after 3 weeks of use, it still looks new. The bottom of the grill pan has a 2" wide circle that is cut into the bottom, reducing the thickness of the pan in this area, most likely to provide even heating. What I don\'t like about the pan is the 12"x12" area is small, a slice of bacon doesn\'t fit but as it shrinks, it does fit. As per the instructions I use only Low to just about Medium heat, and the pan warped making the center higher than the perimeter. Right in the area of this reduced thickness area. I used a rubber mallet to pound it down for the next use. Just a heads up, using low heat does increase cooking time. I hope this is helpful info. If this pan was made thicker and 13"x13", I think it would be perfect!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Handy for pancakes', 'author': 'RMB', 'rating': 4, 'content': "For the most part it is non-stick and very easy to clean. If an egg yolk breaks I found that they can sometimes temporarily stick making it a little difficult to flip the egg over. However to clean it after you're done it comes right off. Also the edge of the pan all the way around is not very high so if you are used to cracking an egg on the edge of a pan, it can be a little cumbersome. Overall I'm pleased with the purchase especially for use with pancakes. Plenty of room to pour for and easily flip them over with no sticking!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Wood handles are well made.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Impressed my parents!!!', 'author': 'crazycatgizmo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have a set of these and when my parents visited they fell in love with them so I bought them a set for Christmas. They said they are the best pans they have ever had and my stepmom was a cook for many years. Easy to put together - wipe clean even if something gets a bit too crispy. Best part is they are super lightweight so it does not fell like you are trying to wash a basketball when doing dishes', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Obsessed with this cookware', 'author': 'Jessica Skupien', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We've been using cast iron cookware for the last couple years, which I've never liked because it was always heavy, difficult to clean, and never felt fully clean even after washing (this very well may be user error but I shouldn't have to work that hard to effectively use a pan). I finally decided to replace the cast iron with something more functional and came across this Sensarte set after reading many reviews of various options across Amazon.After using them for about a month, I can say I have zero regrets about making the switch, as I am completely satisfied with this new cookware!What I love most is that these are truly non stick. Two of the things I cook most often are pancakes and eggs and I don't even need to spray the pan before cooking and yet both food items slide right off.After I’m done cooking, I rarely have to do anything beyond spray them with water and all the remaining food bits slide right off. As someone who hates cooking because it takes so long to prepare and cook food, and then you only eat for like 10 minutes, and then you have to clean it all up after, I very much value pans that take little to no effort to clean.This set feels quite sturdy and will definitely not warp like some other pans I've tried over the years. They even come with pot protectors, which are equally helpful to protect my cabinets shelves from getting scratched. I was also pleased that they come with a silicone spatula and spoon to help you avoid scratching the surface of the cookware.They’re also so much more aesthetically pleasing than cast iron!10/10 recommend. If I ever need to expand the number of pots or pans I have, I would definitely buy more Sensarte products.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars I love this cookware, but I guess I'm in the honeymoon period?", 'author': 'Nathan Ostrander', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Our collection of cookware needed a serious upgrade. Neither the wife or I are what you would call kitchen or cookware experts... we cook a lot, but do not find it to be a source of great enjoyment/passion. Nor are we particularly great at it :) That said, I was not super keen to invest in high end cookware that was likely more than we need. I started looking around on Amazon and came across these Sensarte, granite finish pans. I ordered a single skillet in the interest of exploring, based on their slightly retro vibe, solid reviews and low price point. It shipped quickly and performed admirably in addition to being lovely to look at.We then came across the 8 piece set and decided to toss out all the old, burnt out cookware odds and ends we'd been using for a long while. The price point on the set was a major selling point. At this point, we have used them a bit and couldn't be happier... they fit our whole, funky vibe and the price was right. I'm now planning to order a couple of smaller pots/saucepans to round out our inventory.At this point, I can say that:- They feel great in your hand and on the stove. The slightly rubberized handles are quite nice feeling. They are indeed light as advertised.- We start at a low setting and gradually raise the temp as their directions indicate. The heat seems to distribute quite evenly (also as advertised.)- They also clean up quite easily and are also egg-cellent... for making the eggs (see what I did there?)In summation, would definitely recommend for the average household user. Totally possible that someone with more demanding requirements would want to go up a level or 2 higher, but I think we're going to be quite happy with them and you can't beat the price. If they hold up to my heavy handed cooking for the next few months, I'll probably add a star to this review.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Cuisinart 17-Piece Cookware Set, Chef's Classic Nonstick Hard Anodized, 66-17

This is not the brand he requested. His mom bought the set he wanted so rather than return these I decided after 35 years of using the same pots and pans I deserved a new set. I am so glad I did! I’ve used them daily since late November and I absolutely love them. They’re weighty enough that they can take heat but not too heavy for my arthritic hands to handle. The handles don’t get hot on the stovetop and clean up is a breeze. I’ve used so much less oil than I used to when sautéing or searing and the flame doesn’t have to be as high (I have a gas stovetop) to get the same cooking temp. I’ve not had a problem with any food sticking nor seen any scratches and I’ll admit I stack them inside one another since I don’t have the space to hang them.If you’re thinking about these I would definitely recommend them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cuisinart 17-Piece Cookware Set Dads Secret Weapon', 'author': 'Michael Hays', 'rating': 5, 'content': "As a cooking enthusiast, dad and grandpa investing in the Cuisinart 17-piece Cookware Set was a decision I don't regret. I can slide an omelet from the pan straight to my plate without leaving a trace behind. Cleanup is a breeze!In terms of variety, the set is very generous. With seven lids, a strainer, three skillets, a large pan, and an array of pots, I have the ideal tool for every recipe I want to undertake. The large pot works great for mac-n-cheese or boiling eggs.Trust this dad: the Cuisinart 17-Piece Cookware Set is a game-changer. After using it, you'll wonder how you ever managed without it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great price for such a good set', 'author': 'nonspecific', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I bought the 10 piece Cuisinart set about a month ago and ever since I've been expecting it to fall to pieces, burst, turn to dust, explode, vanish in thin air, etc. etc... anything that would give me a reason for the low price of 140$ which is 400$ in stores. The truth is, it's too good to be true. But it is! This is the best cookware set I have ever seen by far. Nothing will ever be able to stick to these lovely pots and pans, no matter what you do, so be ready to say goodbye to all the non-stick sprays, oil, butter and soaking and scratching. They don't even need harsh soaps for a moderate cleaning up. It is true that they can burn food, but the instructions say that these are not meant to be used at high stove-top heats anyway, use a low to mid heat and everything will turn up wonderful. They are really good for slow cooking and can also go in the oven up to 500 degrees, which is required for some food I like to make. The glass lids are useful when making rice or seeing the color of vegetables but they can spill if nor handled properly due to the design, which could certainly improve since they are, unlike the pots, not very easy to clean. My handles have never got too hot unlike my previous Faberware set. I adore the small skillet which is just the right size for a 2 egg french omlete, in general, the sizes are logical and all come in handy. It does say they are metal utensil safe, which is not exactly true since it's OK with a fork or spoon, but any hand held electronic gadget can scratch the interior a little. Also, although the dark gray outer finish is beautiful, it seems that the colour will be wearing of in time.To sum it up, if you're willing to give some extra attention to this good-looking set (drying after hand washing, preferably hanging and keeping the lids clean) this is a deal you must not miss. BTW, It arrived very quickly and was packed great by Amazon. You won't be able to use any piece in this set at high stove top heats, so get a cheap large skillet for that kind of job, give away your old set and buy this one like I did. I doubt anyone will ever regret it. I would give 4 1/2 stars if I could due to the not-so-good lid design facor. Still, I love my cookware set, will probably be using it for at least 10 years to come and recommend it fully to anybody.EDIT AFTER 6 YEARSI've just gave away this set after 6 years of daily use. So, they didn't last for 10 years as I was predicting in my initially overly psyched review, but I still think it was a great deal for the price. Now that I have more money to spend and need a more professional level cookware set, I've replaced them with stainless steel Fissler pots and pans, which in my opinion, are the best you can get for any price, anywhere.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 27, 2004', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Used for 3 years now', 'author': 'Army Family', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I’m not sure why so many have complained about these pans but I love mine. Even cheese that gets on the pan when cooking comes off easily.It is an elegant looking set.While it is. not exciting or like the newer brands, Cuisinart is a good solid name with good products. Overall very pleased with this set.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: STANLEY Adventure The Nesting Two Cup Cookset
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Astonishingly clever set, for an unbelievable price!', 'author': 'Candid Reviewer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I sold camping gear at a major outfitter for a number of years, and I\'ve been a gear-junkie for over half my life. I can\'t believe I\'ve never come across this set before now, but I haven\'t. And I also can\'t believe how absolutely perfect this set is for a minimalist expeditioner, at such an unbelievably low cost. The price is fair as-is, but I would expect it to cost three times as much since inferior designed sets by well-known ultralight brands usually cost a lot more, and since the price of stainless steel has gone up so much in recent years.Here\'s what is amazing about this cookset...PERFECT SIZE FOR ONE OR TWO MINIMALISTS. Usually, a cookset that is designed for two will be appreciably larger, but if you\'re a minimalist and like to keep things simple, there is plenty of space here without overdoing it. The pot holds 24 fl. oz. which means you can toss in a typical can of food, such as chili or spaghettios, and heat it right up without having to fill it dangerously to the brim. It also happens to be exactly the right size for two or three cups of instant hot chocolate, and enough for the water requirements of many prepackaged dehydrated meals. In my experience a lot of cooksets are either a little too small or (far more commonly) larger or more awkwardly sized than they need to be. I much prefer a narrow, taller pot to a really wide, shallow one, but they can be hard to find. This one is perfect.ACCEPTABLE WEIGHT. Backpackers who count every gram may grumble to see that it\'s made of stainless instead of titanium, but the weight will be quite acceptable to all but the most obsessive ultralight folks. The stainless steel is thin enough to minimize weight without being so thin as to deform easily under pressure or heat. I\'ve seen other stainless sets made from such thin gauge metal that they actually "oil can" (warp or deform) when they get too hot. Not with this set. I\'ve also seen stainless sets so thick they felt like a brick to carry. Again, not with this set.VERSATILE DESIGN. Nested inside the set are two 10 oz. plastic cups, sized perfectly for a cup of hot chocolate or a small bowl of hot food. They also are quite thick, so they don\'t transfer heat to your hands. I poured in some steaming hot chocolate and could barely feel the warmth as I gripped the cup. That means you don\'t have to wait for the pot to cool a bit before pouring the contents into the cups. The lid of the set is stainless steel and contains a series of small 1/8" diameter vent holes (a row of six holes on one side, and a single hole on the opposite side). At first glance, their purpose is to release steam to show you when your food is hot, which is already a nice feature. However, I also realized that they are designed so they can be used as a strainer to strain water away after cooking pasta or another hydrate-able food.A small plastic tab on the lid offers a cool place to grab the lid even after several minutes of cooking. Other reviewers have noted that the tab can melt over time, but I suspect that would only be after extended cooking. I saw no problems with melting after six minutes of boiling water. The tab is tensioned so that it lays flat when packed away, but can stand erect while cooking (for easy grabbing without burning your fingers).A folding wire handle on one side of the pot snaps down into place for cooking, and has a small "spreader" bar that slides into place so you don\'t accidentally pinch the wires together to release the locked position inadvertently. When you want to fold it up, you slide the spreader bar back, squeeze the wires together, and lift. The handle rotates up and snaps down over the top to hold the lid on (and the contents in) during transit. Since it is wire, it diffuses heat quickly. After several minutes of cooking, the handle was barely warm and easy to hold. It is slightly longer than the handles on other cookware I\'ve used. That, combined with the taller height of the pot, seems to keep it cooler than the (similar) wire handles on other compact cookware I\'ve used.On the pot, there are also measuring marks imprinted in the stainless for 6, 12, 16, and 20 oz. (or 237, 355, 473, and 591 mL, respectively). These marks are visible on both the inside and outside of the pot, so they allow quick, easy measurements when you need a precise amount of liquid to rehydrate a meal or cook to a recipe.OUTSTANDING PRICE: After having owned several nice cooksets from SnowPeak, MSR, and Brunton, each of which cost in the $40 to $80 range, I was not expecting this cheap set to be so nice. It looked good in pictures, but I wholly expected to receive something flimsy or shoddily made. Fortunately, I trusted some of the positive reviews. As it turns out, the set is very well made and should stand up to a lifetime of camping if properly used and maintained.NOTES: The Stanley Adventure Camp Cookset fits perfectly on my MSR Pocket Rocket stove. I built a gimbal mount so that I can use this as the perfect cookset-on-the-go aboard my 20\' sailboat. It\'s ideal for making hot chocolate or heating a quick lunch when I\'m sailing.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Probably the best value for the money', 'author': 'George H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These things are very well-known in the camping/hiking/backpacking world and need no introduction.Very sturdy, versatile, and perfect size.The included cups are very well-made, but most people remove at least one cup to make better use of space inside the pot for storing stoves, fuel, etc.Cheap Walmart GSI-style cup nests pretty well the the bottom of the pot and the Stanley's lid fit those style cups too.I'd recommend replacing the plastic pull tab on the lid with a split ring keyring or small S-biner.Don't drill holes for a Billy bail. You can use the folding handle by sliding the cross bar toward the hinge while the handle is folded on top of the pot. It will hold if you do it right.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A highly optimized product to take into the field', 'author': 'chikuzen', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Just the right size for 1-2 people. The nested ceramic cups inside the kettle are genius, and leave extra room for a bag of ground coffee, tea bags, or short spoon and fork -- the volume of the kettle is not a waste of space since it can be filled with useful items. The ceramic of the cups is not brittle -- I had one cup fall to the ground without shattering, and they are not hot to the touch even with freshly brewed coffee inside. The kettle is made of thin stainless steel with measuring marks for water amounts -- light to carry, quick to warm up thus saving fuel, and quick to cool down to put away. Very functional lid, held in place by gravity, thus easy to lift with the attached ceramic handle. The small holes on the edge of the lid are useful for pouring small quantities of hot water or to filter tea or coffee. Well thought out kettle handle with simple and effective mechanism to lock it in place or to lock the lid in place; the handle takes up minimal volume and it does not get hot when boiling water. And cheap, compared to titanium-made or jet-boil-like competitors. Stanley has hit a bull's eye with this kettle --- not easy to over-optimize, it will become a classic!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars PERFECT for backpacking/camping', 'author': 'Joe Fioresi', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This stove is legit. Works well as intended, packs up nicely with 2 sturdy insulated cups -- perfect for hot tea, coffee, or whatever else you want. Insanely great value for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Probably the best value for a minimalist cook set on Amazon.', 'author': 'team W', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is a nice, basic cook set. The pot is made of stainless steel - thin enough not to be too overwhelmingly heavy, but sturdy enough that it should stand up to the usual rigors of camping/backpacking. I am not too worried about this thing getting squished in my pack or denting horribly if I drop it on a rock. The two cups that come inside it are thick, sturdy cups that can handle hot food and drinks without a problem. Each cup has a mark on the inside of it which is about as high as you\'d ever want to put liquid into it. That mark translates into exactly one cup. In addition to the marks on the cups there are also several measurement markings on the cooking pot itself.My biggest concern before ordering this was the shape/design of the cooking pot. It looked long and somewhat narrow - I was worried that it would be unstable when sitting on top of my Pocket Rocket stove. Indeed, when I put it on the stove empty, it looked and felt like an accident waiting to happen. But once it was half full of water, the added weight really settles it down. I wiggled it and jiggled it and poked at it, and it didn\'t tip over. It held in place securely. I think as long as it is at least half full, it shouldn\'t tip over - even in a fairly stiff breeze.Although it is a bit tall, I don\'t think you will need a long-handled spoon to stir it unless you over-fill the pot. It is designed to cook 24 oz, which goes up about halfway up the top part where the pot flares out. A regular-length kitchen spoon can scrape the bottom easily at that depth.The metal conducts heat very quickly - my Pocket Rocket cooks everything absurdly fast, but it felt like this thing conducted the heat into the water even faster than with some of my other stuff.The lid doubles as a strainer and the little strainer holes make it easy to see steam escaping so you can tell when you\'ve got boiling water easily without having to lift the lid. There is a thing to keep your fingers from getting burned while using the lid. I like that the handle for the lid locks up and is rigid.The handle for the pot itself is also very sturdy and sensibly designed. It locks in place very securely both when it is stowed and when it is extended. There is even a tab you slide up the sides to lock the handle in place so you can\'t accidentally fold it while cooking. The handle is, however, completely uninsulated. Just as the pot conducts heat rapidly - the handle gets super hot almost immediately. I boiled about 2 cups of water on my camp stove - the handle was absolutely scorching hot after that. So plan for a fairly serious pot holder of some kind with this thing.The only real downsides to this unit are the fact that the main handle comes with no insulation and the weight. This set is made of stainless steel - that is why you get so much for so little money. You can get a cook set with similar capabilities made out of aluminum that will be noticeably lighter than this one. If you go up to titanium - you can cut even more weight off. But nothing in life is free. You will spend at least 2x-3x what this cost to get a similar set in aluminum. For titanium - it is more like 5x at least (probably more). This thing weighs just about a pound with both cups inside it. Just how much do you want to spend to shave those ounces off? If you are going solo and want to reduce the weight of this - leave one or both of the heavy green, insulated cups it comes with at home. That would be a meaningful weight reduction.It is dishwasher safe, but they warn you in the instructions that using the dishwasher may "prematurely age components". So, in other words, just wash it by hand. I was pleased to see that the bottom of the pot remained shiny and spotless after being subjected to the intense heat of my camp stove. It looks like if you take good care of this thing - it should basically last forever. It is simple and basic, but thoughtfully designed. It is unquestionably a winner for all but the most weight-conscious buyers.EDIT: If you decide to buy this - wash the green cups, then fill them both to the absolute brim with boiling hot water and leave them sit a bit. Then pitch that water and rinse them out. There is something on the inside of the cup that needs to get cleaned out and it doesn\'t come out with just regular hand washing - it only dissolves with boiling hot water. You don\'t want to figure this out in the field. title: Honey Pot Mystery Series Box Set 1: Books 1-3
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fun Exciting Christian Mystery!!!!', 'author': 'Wannee', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a great fun exciting series, this boxset has books 1-3 in the Honey Pot Mystery Series. They are fast-paced mysteries full of mystery, suspense, action with great characters. It's well written with unique and original story line, full of imaginations, unpredictable that flows well with lots of surprise, twists and turns that keeps you guessing of what will happen next, very entertaining and inspirational. I really enjoy this box set and I highly recommend it.I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 17, 2022', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Easy to Listen to and follow', 'author': 'AudioBookReviewer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Lydia is a delightful person with a faith that is strong. Her friends and her community are important to her as well. The friendship and strong Christian faith she and her friends share, they still get into a lot of trouble. While a Christmas pageant, craft fair, and marathon race are impacted by their presence, it is their inability to stay out of the mystery aspect of each disaster. Dead bodies turn up, missing items, and imagine finding a newborn infant in the manger of the nativity scene of the Christmas pageant! Trouble finds and follows Lydia everywhere.The author, Sarah Hualde delivers a delightful cozy mystery-style series. This is the type of series that any person would enjoy because it is easy to follow and the characters are straightforward. I enjoyed the blending of Lydia’s practice of Christian faith with her community and family interactions. The mystery around the social influencer was well done and like the other three flowed smoothly and each had good plot twists. The contrasting of the characters was well done also, the mother of the infant found and her best friend proved to be good foils for one another and tested the faith of Lydia as a “foster-like mom.”The narrator, Jasmine Rose, did a good job of narration but did not provide unique voices for the characters. This is usually helpful to distinguish who is talking but also to project the emotions of each character. She spoke clearly and with a steady cadence that kept each story moving forward. I enjoyed her voice very much, and while it was mainly told from Lydia’s point of view, using unique voices for each character would have made it easier to follow.Overall, this is a delightful series and I look forward to hearing more from Sarah and Jasmine.There were no issues with the production or quality of this audiobook.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2022', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Terrific Series so far', 'author': 'Jennifer80319', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'What a humbling terrific read. The camaraderie between these ladies is phenomenal. Definitely worth the read. I would recommend this book.I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 14, 2022', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful set of books', 'author': 'Ann Ferri', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This collection of books will give you hours of reading pleasure. All of the books are well written and hold your attention from the first page until the last. Love it and highly recommend this set to anyone who enjoys Christian mystery.I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 14, 2022', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice to Have the First Three Together', 'author': 'Jamie Bee', 'rating': 4, 'content': "As always, it’s great to have a box set so you can binge-read a series. I had only read one of these books before, so it was great to get a larger glimpse into the book’s world.Here’s a review of the third book:Farmers’ Market Fatality (Book 3): This story is complicated for a cozy mystery. For one thing, we have four amateur sleuths to follow. Much is going on in their lives and the lives of their family and friends. The book is busy and fast-paced, but the murder isn't even known to be certain until over the 40% mark—and this is a long book. Maybe the author was hoping to build suspense about the missing man, but when the actual murder in a murder mystery is left for too long, it doesn't allow for much development of the murder plot. This is a long novel, so there was still some time for development, but I would have liked to have seen more. It is definitely a book where it felt like the cozy aspect and the mystery aspect were out of balance, with lots of emphasis on the cozy and not quite enough on the mystery. Still, the intertwined lives of the people of Honey Pot were easy to get entangled in.I received a free copy of this book, but that did not affect my review.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2020', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great clean mysteries', 'author': 'Angelofmusic', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was given this free review copy audiobook at my request and have voluntarily left this review.I felt right at home reading these books. Being a mom myself it was nice to hear the juggling of lives and daily stresses amidst the trouble Lydia and her friends get into. These mysteries were filled with adventure, gossip, and many false trails. It is a clean mystery series and I really enjoyed listening to it. Jasmine Rose the narrator did a great job voicing the book. I recommend to those while love “cozy mysteries”.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 9, 2022', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Mysteries', 'author': 'Jeanne Richardson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is the third book I've read written by Sarah Hualde; I can’t wait to read more of her books.This is the three book collection in the Honey Pot Mystery Series; all the books are well written with good story lines.I received a free copy of this boxset via booksprout and I’m voluntarily leaving a review.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 18, 2022', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars sisterhood and faith tested by crime and circumstances', 'author': 'Molly G. Hamblin', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'While I have read other works from this talented author, I initially thought this boxset was a collection of different works.I was pleased to meet the ladies of a town affectionately nick named Honey Pot. Imperfect women of faith, they struggle together and apart to keep themselves, their families and their town safe, and work and pray their way through faith and life.Powerful faith and faults in actionA great series for those who enjoy mysteries and testimonies to faith and life struggles.I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 20, 2022', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars New Age/Mystic healing in there is not for me', 'author': 'Renee Shaw', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I fully enjoyed the first book. I can not get past the second book. I just finished chapter 5 and can not finish. The use of crystals, sounds etc is just to much.
