It might get better but I can not stay around to see.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2022', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Faith + Mystery', 'author': 'Shannon Skinner', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I loved this series! I also enjoy having boxsets so I can binge without any interruptions. All of the storylines/plots were really good and relatable in a way, plus they include God and Christian faith which I truly loved. title: Stanley The Camp Pour Over Set
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars WELL Made, Clean Set Up', 'author': 'Carolyn Salzano', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Really enjoy this coffee making system. The components are all quality made and the design of the funnel is unique to others. It is very easy to clean, helps avoid overflows and therefore less messes, and makes a darn good cup of coffee. The funnel ALSO fits perfectly atop Stanley's thermos too, so I use that as a carafe to make a bunch at a time at home and keep it hot all Saturday morning", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Solid Pour Over', 'author': 'POK', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Even if not used for camping, this is a solid vessel for pour over coffee. I’ve used 2 others that don’t hold up like this one. Those had either glass that feel fragile, or stainless that was not strong. The Stanley pour over is easy to clean as well, not a fuss of parts to balance like the others. The mug also keeps the coffee temperature well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Highly recommend', 'author': 'Maurits', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good quality coffee maker. Easy to use, easy to clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Dang - that's good coffee!", 'author': 'psu-murph', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This thing makes a darn great cup of coffee - one of the best I've had. Some tips:- Test measure how much water your cup will need before adding coffee and hot water. It's easy to use too much water and overfill your cup.- Make sure your coffee is coarsely ground. Fines can get through the mesh filter. I don't mind this, but it seems to bother others.- Be sure to bloom the coffee before pouring all the water in. The bloomed grounds will slow the water passing through the filter for better flavor.- Do NOT fully boil your water. It will over-extract the coffee and create a bitter cup.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Bought for use in a class B van however,', 'author': 'robert walker', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Pros-it’s fun to use and the brew is tasty. Fairly easy to make a cup in a few minutes. Looks great on any counter was one of the appeals that drew me in. Good size for a limited space/storage situation with the 2 piece design. Use the built in filter or paper filter - even at home the paper filter is best solution for me.Cons-2 piece setup doesn’t attach, do don’t knock the top over! No issues so far just fyi. Again, the included metal filter works fine, but in a camper (limited water) to rinse and clean after each brew (will not let any grinds go down the RV sink) I immediately bought a large pack of cheap paper filters and they work great- zero mess but does add to the waste can. And a biggie here. I love the mug but the base is too big for for a couple of my vehicle’s so have hold onto it. I use hot just boiled water but the brew isn’t that hot when finished? Which actually I use the lowest heat setting on the Kureig anyway but this is only sort of warm??Last con-uses more coffee per brew vs. my reusable k-cup. Toting a lot of coffee for the Stanley is a consideration when packing for travel in a small space. So—I’ll keep it for the house- it’s cool and fun to use at home with a good tasting brew. (I use retail Maxwell or Folgers medium ground) it’s economical and good enough coffee for me!However, I’ll buy a slim Kureig’s for the Sprinter so I can reuse my old refillable k-cup and have the handy attached water tank as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for Camping', 'author': 'jason ward', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works great and is tough as nails. Use this when camping, it gets banged around pretty good and has held up great...plus looks really kool too.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great coffee brewer', 'author': 'TJW', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great for making coffee (1 cup) at home or camping. Recommended.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Convenient', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is so great for solo camping or just when you want to make a single cup of coffee. Easy to use and easier to clean', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not just for camping', 'author': 'JeanieP', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this for when traveling. I dislike those hotel motel coffee makers. They are usually dirty and who knows how old the coffee they supply is. This way I can make my own coffee. I bring my own coffee and this nifty device.you do need boiling water however.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely the best', 'author': 'Amber Callicutt', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Best pour over set of any I’ve owned!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: The Magical World of Strega Nona: a Treasury
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A sturdy anthology', 'author': 'Stephanie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I grew up reading the Strega Nona books, and I was delighted to find this on a friend's shower registry. It's a great way to have all the stories at hand and much sturdier than the individual paperback books thanks to the hard cover. I think I'll get one for my nephew, too!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars If you love Tomie DePaola, buy the set.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Tomie DePaola is one of my favorite children's authors. I sent this set as a gift for children aged 2 through 6. It was appreciated. I would recommend buying one of his books at first to see if you like his writing style before buying a set of his books.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Must Have for your Tomie dePaola Collection', 'author': 'Lady Lu', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been reading Tomie dePaola\'s books to my children and now my grandchildren since1978. He is a wonderful creative storyteller and you can tell the stories are from his background - from his soul.This particular collection of Strega Nona stories is in a large hardcover book - like an encyclopedia with extra info from the author including a map of the settings in Italy and some recipes too. The CD, in the author\'s voice, is especially pleasing because he knows how to pronounce many of the special Italian words that I have heard other narrators destroy. It will help you learn how to say them yourself when you read all the other stories. The CD is only of one story in the collection. I have also bought additional individual books in the Strega Nona series because my 3 grandchildren love the stories.(ages 5, 9,and 12) I am of Italian Heritage, 3rd generation in USA so they mean so much more to me. I also love his stories about the Irish side of his family, especially the book "Nana Upstairs, Nana Downstairs" and also "Tom" about his very funny Grandpa.You will be missed Tomie de Paola. Thank you for your contributions to the minds of all children.- from a NY Mama', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 8, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful book!', 'author': 'Kim McKinney', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Really wonderful good quality book with great stories. My grands love the Strega Nona stories.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Most loved children’s stories', 'author': 'Francesca', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Delightful tales read over and over yet kids don’t get tired of hearing them. Beautifully illustrated and vibrant colors in hardback book. Strong enough to pass down to the next generation.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It captures all about Strega Nona in one book!!!', 'author': 'Courtland I Shook', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Who doesn’t want to know more about your character, Strega Nona. So glad we found this book!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The Magical World of Strega Nona', 'author': 'Cynthia Gomez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Beautiful book and happy with my purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Beloved children's books we passed down to our son", 'author': 'Tony Midolo', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It all started with a trip to our local library. My 6 year old fell in love with Strega Nona like I did so many years ago. I tease my son that while I don't have a magic pasta pot I do have a magic chicken pan from my great grandma. He was hooked. On a rainy day or whenever it's great to curl up with these classics and read them over and over again. Passing on the same feel good stories and laughs I had as a kid to my son", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars There is no audio CD included', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'One of the reasons we were so eager to buy this was because of the beautiful audio cd that says is included but I ordered and re-ordered with no CD in either. Kinda bummed!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Charming Collection of Tales', 'author': 'boomer48', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This collection of Strega Nona stories is bright, beautifully illustrated, and a wonderful way to introduce children to another culture and another time. Each tale emphasizes the love Strega Nona and her sidekick Big Anthony have for one another. His mistakes become a source of forgiveness and laughter. No shame in making mistakes here as each one becomes a lesson for the characters and the audience. I highly recommend this treasury; it's as magical as Strega Nona is herself.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 12, 2021', 'is_verified': True}]

title: The Pout-Pout Fish
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ocean of optimism', 'author': 'Gizem Aktan', 'rating': 5, 'content': '"Pout-Pout Fish" by Deborah Diesen is a delightful underwater adventure that dives into themes of self-discovery, friendship, and the power of a positive outlook. 🐟 The protagonist, Mr. Pout-Pout Fish, initially sees himself as inherently gloomy, spreading "dreary-wearies" to everyone he encounters. However, as the story unfolds, he learns that he has the ability to change his perspective and bring joy to those around him.What makes this book truly special is its engaging rhyming narrative that effortlessly flows like the ocean waves. The repetition and rhythm not only captivate young readers but also make it an enjoyable read-aloud experience for parents. The whimsical illustrations by Dan Hanna complement the storyline beautifully, depicting the underwater world and its lively inhabitants with vibrant colors and expressive characters.As a parent, I appreciate how this book subtly introduces emotional intelligence. It teaches children about the influence of attitude on their interactions with others and promotes the idea that one has the power to shape their own narrative. The transformative journey of Mr. Pout-Pout Fish instills a valuable lesson about resilience and the potential for positive change. 📚✨', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It’s hard board pages', 'author': 'Tammy T.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Loved the story. My 5 yr old thought it was a baby book. The story is cute for his age.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sweet book to read to your children', 'author': 'FL Sunshine', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Such a cute book to read to your children…. title: Smile, Pout-Pout Fish (A Pout-Pout Fish Mini Adventure, 1)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars If you have young kids, this book is a must', 'author': 'Monica Kaye', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is an abbreviated book in comparison to the other released Pout-Pout fish books. It is perfect for in the car or on the go, and satisfies my one and three year old when they start begging to read a Pout-Pout fish book. We have a Pout-Pout fish plush and the previously released books, so this third one is a welcomed change. I also like that it is a board book, since my other two have suffered from being read so often. I literally have taped pages back in that were completely torn out. If you haven't heard of this series, I feel like you would like it's catchy beat and positive morals. Plus there is a great Youtube video that compliments the first book, which is great when you don't have time to read it yourself. Overall - I love Deborah Diesen and her fun characters!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great series!', 'author': 'April Ray', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Grandsons favorite book!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 2, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I adore this book.', 'author': 'Steven', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Kaleidescape of mope...hulky bulky sulking... .need there any more to be said!Adorable and cute little book.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 10, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Loved', 'author': 'DragonballZ', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My friend's daughter loves these books. It is a great intro to the world of PPF and once you've read this one you will be ready for more! These books are so very expressive so it's a great way to really get into the story with your little. title: Collectible Teapot & Tea Wall Calendar 2022: 365 days of afternoon tea and delectable treats.
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for Teapot Lovers', 'author': 'Lucy Ray', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have bought this calendar for years. I used to give it to my office assistant for Christmas every year. She is a teapot collector, loves this. The beautiful photos and description of the teapots depicted in the picture are wonderful. The "date squares" are easy to read and large enough to jot things down in. We both enjoyed having this hang in our office. Now I am retired but I still am happy to buy this lovely calendar for her every year, it has become a "Christmas Tradition" to us. Over the years the quality of this calendar has remeained high. Shipping was fast, and it always arrives in perfect condition. If you, or someone you know likes beautiful teapots you will LOVE this calendar.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Favorite Calendar', 'author': 'Jim Walsh', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Years ago I started buying my wife this Teapot calendar for Christmas. And every year, it seems it gets better and better. From the pictures of tea pots or tea settings, to the informative trivia surrounding Tea and the culture of tea, the calendar is more than something to tell us the dates, but a reminder of how pleasant it is to enjoy Tea. I actually look forward each month to the uncovering of the next month, and what images we will see and what information is presented. The author does a really good job of putting together a very professional and pleasing product. I am never disappointed in it. If you enjoy Tea, this is a very nice calendar to add to your Tea culture at home.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect calendar for tea enthusiasts', 'author': 'Tracey Filar Atwood', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been getting this calendar for more than 20 years now, and it never disappoints! On a practical level, the daily boxes are large enough to contain notes about appointments, events, and other reminders--we hang this in the kitchen and use this as our central household calendar to keep the family organized.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bestie gets me this every year!', 'author': 'Eve', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My best friend has been buying me this teapot calendar every Christmas for 15 years. title: The Pout-Pout Fish Goes to School (A Pout-Pout Fish Adventure)
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Read the book through a child's eyes and ears and it makes perfect sense", 'author': 'Prudence Lamb', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had to roll my eyes at some of the reviews and "messaging" that were written.NO WHERE in the book does pout pout fish say "he\'s stupid"He says "I am not smart", "I\'ll never get it", "I don\'t belong" "I should forget it"Upon entering his first day of school, he gets lost and doesn\'t know where to go. Peering in shyly to other classrooms, he feel he doesn\'t belong because everyone is working on projects/activities that are way above his level.His teacher finds him as he\'s about to give up. She corrects his negative thoughts/feelings and affirms he doesn\'t have to know what he hasn\'t learned yet.As a mother to a four year old it\'s easy to see my son getting frustrated, wanting to give up. However, channeling the emotions, correction/ affirming is part of helping him realize, he can do hard things.At the end of the story the entire class looks back fondly on the message of positive self talk and realizing they were able to accomplish what they put their mind to, once they learned it.Maybe a little deep of a review for a children\'s book. However, I felt the need to steer the message of what I think the book was trying to convey. Humans get frustrated, turned around, lost. It opened up conversation of daily frustrations and working through road blocks my kid faces every day. Get the book. It\'s pout pout fish.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pout Pout Fish never fails.', 'author': 'Mary Locke', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My grandkids and students love Pout Pout Fish. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Pots', 'author': 'CJ Hudson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These pots are wonderful! They heat evenly, clean up nicely, and look great. A little pricey but worth it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This was part of the 12-piece set I purchased.', 'author': 'Judy L.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This was part of the 12-piece set I purchased. I have looked at this cookware before and have seen a few advertisements on it. In the past, I hesitated trying it since, in most of the pictures and videos, it looks like it has a bumpy or rough interior. When I saw the 7-quart hybrid sauce pan, I decided I had to try it to replace a 7-quart Staub Dutch oven that I have. I was so impressed by this sauce pan, I decided to buy the 12-piece set of this cookware. This set was shipped in two boxes. One box include the 6-piece pot set with lids ( 2 and 3 quart pots and 8 quart stock pot), and the other box included the 6-piece frying pan set with lids (8, 10, and 12 inch frying pans with lids).I cook quite a lot and have quit a lot of cookware of various types and brands, including Staub, Le Creuset, cast iron, , Tramontina, carbon steel, Calphalon stainless steel, and Ninja Premium cookware. In most of these, I have complete, or almost complete, sets of every piece available in each type of cookware. Each of these has their pros and cons, and all are very non-stick aside from cast iron and carbon steel that must be well seasoned.Since this review is for the HexClad cookware, I will not get into the pros and cons of each type of cookware, but will compare the HexClad cookware to some of them and let you know why I prefer this cookware over some of the others.It should be noted that it is suggested to wash and season the cookware with vegetable oil before using. I used Crisco shortening which I also use on my cast iron pans. When I seasoned the pans, the oil was completely absorbed. After the initial seasoning, these pans should not need to be seasoned again even when cleaned with soap and water. Cast iron and carbon steel pans should be seasoned after every use.So, what do I like about this cookware as compared to the other cookware I have?1 - Cast iron, and enameled cast iron is very heavy and must be seasoned after every use to maintain it. This cookware does not required seasoning after it is done initially. Carbon steel is not as heavy, but must also be seasoned after every use.2 - Stainless steel cookware needs to be cleaned very time with Bar Keeper's Friend to keep it clean and shiny. The HexClad cookware does have stainless steel on the exterior, but is easier to keep looking shiny since cooking is not done on it. Wash and dry works.3 - Most of the cookware mentioned above can be relatively nonstick when used and seasoned properly and after learning how to use it. Stainless cookware can be more challenging since temperature and what you cook can be issues. Cast iron, carbon steel, and even enameled cookware depends on persistent seasoning after every use aside from the Ninja Premium cookware that maintains a nonstick, easy to clean surface as does the HexClad cookware. Other than Tramontina cookware, the nonstick surfaces of most are durable.4 - As for weight, the cast iron and enameled cast iron (Staub and Le Creuset) are the heaviest, carbon steel comes in second, and HexClad and Ninja are about the same.5- The warranty for HexClad is lifetime vs. the Ninja warranty that is 5-10 year depending on whether you register cookware on the Ninja website. For the HexClad cookware, you must save your purchase receipt.This is all of the differences I can think of for now. If I think of more, I will add them. For now, I am impressed with the HexClad cookware, but I will not likely eliminate much of the cookware I already have. As mentioned previously, each has their own benefits. I may eventually decide to eliminate some of the heavier cookware as it is more difficult to use. I may also eliminate cookware that requires more maintenance.I will update this review if my opinion changes. I hope this review was helpful for you.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really are worth the higher price so far.', 'author': 'Fuzms', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Lately I had been treating pans as almost disposable. Nonstick is also great.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely love my new pots', 'author': 'Tricia G', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Love my new HexClad hybrid pots! Very nice quality/construction. Recently moved and downsized, and these were my home warming gift to myself. Makes cooking a real pleasure when you have such great pots to use. Easy to clean. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best pans', 'author': 'Jason', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are by far the best pans I've ever owned. Worth the money !", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super Impressed - Recommending to Others', 'author': 'WV Shopper', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Hexclad immediately drew my attention with their sexy hexagonal design and contrasting colored cookware (instead of just an ordinary monochrome stainless steel). So pleased that I ordered the largest set that I could find, along with some additional pots (18 pieces total). I pre-washed, then afterwards pre-seasoned the interior with olive oil (as recommended). After using the nicely-weighted pots/pans for two months, I concur with the reviews below (e.g., very durable, very easy cleanup, very pleased) The equal heat distribution is also worth noting since it enables cooking on lower heat and NOT having to shift items around in the pan to avoid hot spots. I use my 1-quart pot as often as I do my larger pots!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Hexcellent Culinary Magic', 'author': 'Riad B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Prepare to be hex-cited, fellow food enthusiasts, because the Hexclad pan set is about to change your cooking game in ways you never hex-pected! (See what I did there? Sorry, couldn't resist.)When it comes to kitchen sorcery, this pan set is nothing short of magical. From the moment you lay eyes on its sleek hexagonal design, you know you're in for a culinary adventure like no other. It's like having a cauldron straight out of Hogwarts, minus the bubbling potions and broomsticks, of course.Let's talk about the non-stick hexagonal surface, which is truly a kitchen wizard's dream. It's like the Teflon gods descended from the heavens and bestowed upon us a pan that makes food glide effortlessly like a graceful ballerina on ice. No more scrubbing and scraping stuck-on messes while muttering incantations under your breath.But wait, there's more! The Hexclad pan set also features a hybrid construction that combines the best of both stainless steel and non-stick materials. It's like having the strength of a dragon and the gentleness of a unicorn all in one pan. It heats up evenly, retains heat like a master spellcaster, and allows for precise temperature control.Now, let me tell you about the first time I cooked with these pans. As I gently sautéed some veggies, I couldn't help but feel a sense of culinary wizardry coursing through my veins. The food cooked to perfection, evenly browned and beautifully caramelized. I almost expected sparks to fly out of the pan, but alas, it seems the magic was contained within the hexagonal surface.The ergonomic handles are like the wands of comfort, offering a secure grip that won't leave your hands feeling like they've been subjected to a Petrificus Totalus spell. And did I mention that these pans are oven-safe too? That's right, you can conjure up a masterpiece on the stovetop and then effortlessly transfer it to the oven for the finishing touches.In conclusion, if you're looking to add a touch of culinary enchantment to your kitchen, the Hexclad pan set is the answer to your cooking prayers. Whether you're a seasoned chef or a beginner in the world of potions and recipes, these pans will have you casting spells of deliciousness with every dish you create. So wave your spatula like a wand, slip on your chef's hat, and prepare to unlock a realm of culinary magic that will leave your taste buds spellbound. Accio Hexclad pan set!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality is not cheap', 'author': 'Dennis Strapon Jr', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These pans are not for freshman college kids. These pans are for the serious home cook who truely enjoys the process of cooking and can appreciate perfection. These pans are so perfectly designed to deliver high performance, quality meals, with complete temperature control. Its amazing how little heat it takes for these pans to perform compared to literally every other pan Ive ever used. They are not cheap, and are not light, but the quality is second to none. Im a big Gordon Ramsay fan, but was a little leary about these pans, thinking he's just trying to make money, but after using them, he's the perfect spokesman for this product! Try them, you will only be disappointed you didnt buy them sooner!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth It and More', 'author': 'Jon M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Personal Experience: These pans are awesome to cook in! They distribute heat extremely well when cooking which is one of the key things to look at inside of a good cooking skillet. Cleaning I personally add a bit of water to the pan and use a high heat silicon spatula to remove anything left after cooking. HexClad does say you can use metal utensils on them. Personally, I wouldn't recommend that one bit. Hexclad does give a lifetime warranty but not from minor scratches, so buyer beware. Yes, they are scratch resistant, NOT scratch proof.These are not your typical nonstick or stainless steel skillets. They are designed to work with the functionality of both styles of pans. You need to season these skillets prior to use. You do not season them like a normal seasoning of a cast iron for say, but inside the packaging or HexClads Website it will tell you how to season them.Overall, I am very pleased with this purchase!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The hype is real, but... it turns out you have to know how to cook', 'author': 'Karl Houseknecht', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'If I\'d only had YouTube to assist in my purchase decision, I\'d have never bought these pans. Everyone is a critic. Everyone complains the pans aren\'t non-stick. It also turns out that none of these people giving the pans terrible reviews seem to have the faintest idea how to cook in the first place.If you dump scrambled eggs into a dry non-stick pan of any make or model, they\'re going to stick. And probably burn. Every single YouTube review tries the "egg test" by putting an egg into a hot, dry pan and guess what happens? If you dump frozen ravioli into a dry non-stick pan, they aren\'t going to thaw, much less cook, and they\'ll have scorch marks. If you try to make fried rice in a non-stick wok but don\'t use a drop of oil, the rice is going to stick and burn. If I tune into your HexClad product review and you tell me that you had to go to the store to buy vegetable oil to season the pans because you don\'t normally use any in your cooking, I\'m going to turn that video right off.So here\'s the deal: Are HexClad non-stick pans? Yes. And also no. They are hybrid cookware. But they are unique hybrid cookware unlike any I\'ve owned or tried. Must you use some oil in your cooking? 100% yes. It\'s actually in the instruction sheet that comes with the pans. Also, it\'s proper technique. How else are you going to ensure proper heat transfer to the food? Again, think about what you\'re buying here: hybrid cookware. A hybrid of what? A hybrid of non-stick cookware, which, no matter the brand, still will require some kind of oil or fat to be properly non-stick, and of stainless steel cookware, which most definitely requires oil or fat to be non-stick.The bottom line on this whole "they aren\'t non-stick" nonsense is that they most certainly are. When you want them to be. When you use proper cooking techniques.Now, how did they work out for me? I\'m not a chef. I\'m a home cook. But I like to think I\'m an above average home cook. Two of my good friends are foodies. One of them actually is a chef. The other is a skilled home cook and recently purchased a set of HexClad, which he really likes. We often cook and eat together.First test, after following the seasoning instructions, was with the 12" pan. I made sichuan chicken using boneless, skinless chicken thighs. While skeptical at first, I heated the pan on medium low as instructed, thinking no way is this going to be hot enough. With a little oil in the pan once it came up to temperature (within 2 minutes at that), the chicken cooked and even browned. Developed a nice sear on the outside. Beautiful, gorgeous color. And yet, when turning the meat it released from the pan with zero resistance and no residue left stuck on the pan surface. Removing the chicken, I added a tbsp more oil and in went the peppers and onion. Again, a gorgeous result. Nice searing and no sticking. Added the meat back, added sauce, and the same meal I had prepared the night before in my quality non-stick skillet actually looked far more appetizing. And it was delicious. I dare say, even better due to the increased Maillard reaction over standard non-stick pans. Clean up entailed a wet sponge and a gentle wipe and rinse and it was clean. Nothing stuck. No discoloration. Soap and water finish.After enjoying my meal, I just had to know if the pans were going to pass the test that would make them a keeper for me: the French Omelette test. So I heated up the 10" pan, scrambled and seasoned three eggs, and threw a knob of butter into the pan. Medium low heat was plenty enough to get the job done. I worked quickly, keeping the eggs moving to avoid forming large curds. Once nearly set, I began rolling. The egg came away from the pan without a single stick, and without even the need to add more butter to release it as I would in my regular non-stick pans. Perfect, soft, yellow (not browned), creamy French Omelette. Clean up was a non-event. Aside from a bit of butter there wasn\'t anything for the soap, water, and sponge to remove. This test sealed the deal for me.I have other decent pans: All-Clad D3 12" and 10" pans, and three non-stick Oxo 8", 10", and 12" pans (top rated by America\'s Test Kitchen). The All-Clads can work okay, but they were mostly a disappointment. They take too long to heat up, the heat dissipates quickly when food is added, and they have cold spots around the outside where there isn\'t direct flame. The Oxo pans are actually pretty great, but they have rubber handles which can\'t go into the oven, and even medium heat just isn\'t hot enough. Not the pan\'s fault, but you\'ll never get a sear on a non-stick surface. My goal here was to have ONE set of pans that could get proper searing, could be used in the oven, and still have non-stick properties. I have achieved that goal with the HexClad pans. My All-Clad and Oxo pans will be gifted to someone. I have no need for them anymore.Handles: Nice, fat handles on the HexClad that don\'t turn in your hands or get hot. The worst thing about the All-Clad D3\'s are the handles. I have nearly dumped the contents of both pans when tossing as the handles rotated in my palm. They are the absolute worst. I absolutely LOVE the HexClad handles.Lids: Every HexClad pan came with a nice, glass lid that fits perfectly, and has a steam vent. All-Clad? Because my D3 set didn\'t come with lids initially, All-Clad doesn\'t and won\'t sell them separately. I called All-Clad when I got them and asked if they\'d sell me some lids and they basically told me to go pound sand. They were actually rude and dismissive.Heat distribution: As mentioned, the All-Clad D3\'s didn\'t evenly distribute the heat to the outsides of the pan surface that weren\'t directly over flame, nor did they keep the heat when food was added. Even cranking the flame up to high was never enough to get a good sear. Not so with the HexClad. I was sure that the warning to not heat them above medium had something to do with the non-stick surface (and it might), but it\'s just not necessary to go any higher. The outsides of the pan are just as hot as the middle and they sear so well, keeping their heat even as food is added. They perform almost like carbon steel or cast iron in this regard.Non-stick: Covered this, but it bears repeating that these actually are non-stick when used properly.Appearance: They\'re gorgeous, aren\'t they? My friend\'s set has no discoloration after several months of daily, hard use, and he\'s never had to use Barkeeper\'s Friend or any scouring. They are absolutely stunning under the LED cook lights of my hood. Prettier by far than the All-Clad.I\'ve ordered the 2, 3, and 8 QT pot set, which arrives tomorrow, and expect to be equally happy if these pans are any indication. I also have a 10" wok arriving next week for my near daily stir fries. At some point, I may also add a 1 QT pot and 7 QT deep saute.The bottom line is that these pans aren\'t going to miraculously make you cook better. But they WILL reward good technique with superior results. I was skeptical coming into this that I wouldn\'t like them nearly as much as what I already had but any hesitation is gone. The hype is real with this tech.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 16, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This was part of the 12-piece set I ordered', 'author': 'Judy L.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This was part of the 12 piece set I ordered that was shipped in 2 boxes. I have looked at this cookware before and have seen a few advertisements on it. In the past, I hesitated trying it since, in most of the pictures and videos, it looks like it has a bumpy or rough interior. When I saw the 7-quart hybrid sauce pan, I decided I had to try it to replace a 7-quart Staub Dutch oven that I have. I was so impressed by this sauce pan, I decided to buy the 12-piece set of this cookware. This set was shipped in two boxes. One box include the 6-piece pot set with lids ( 2 and 3 quart pots and 8 quart stock pot), and the other box included the 6-piece frying pan set with lids (8, 10, and 12 inch frying pans with lids).I cook quite a lot and have quit a lot of cookware of various types and brands, including Staub, Le Creuset, cast iron, , Tramontina, carbon steel, Calphalon stainless steel, and Ninja Premium cookware. In most of these, I have complete, or almost complete, sets of every piece available in each type of cookware. Each of these has their pros and cons, and all are very non-stick aside from cast iron and carbon steel that must be well seasoned.Since this review is for the HexClad cookware, I will not get into the pros and cons of each type of cookware, but will compare the HexClad cookware to some of them and let you know why I prefer this cookware over some of the others.It should be noted that it is suggested to wash and season the cookware with vegetable oil before using. I used Crisco shortening which I also use on my cast iron pans. When I seasoned the pans, the oil was completely absorbed. After the initial seasoning, these pans should not need to be seasoned again even when cleaned with soap and water. Cast iron and carbon steel pans should be seasoned after every use.So, what do I like about this cookware as compared to the other cookware I have?1 - Cast iron, and enameled cast iron is very heavy and must be seasoned after every use to maintain it. This cookware does not required seasoning after it is done initially. Carbon steel is not as heavy, but must also be seasoned after every use.2 - Stainless steel cookware needs to be cleaned very time with Bar Keeper's Friend to keep it clean and shiny. The HexClad cookware does have stainless steel on the exterior, but is easier to keep looking shiny since cooking is not done on it. Wash and dry works.3 - Most of the cookware mentioned above can be relatively nonstick when used and seasoned properly and after learning how to use it. Stainless cookware can be more challenging since temperature and what you cook can be issues. Cast iron, carbon steel, and even enameled cookware depends on persistent seasoning after every use aside from the Ninja Premium cookware that maintains a nonstick, easy to clean surface as does the HexClad cookware. Other than Tramontina cookware, the nonstick surfaces of most are durable.4 - As for weight, the cast iron and enameled cast iron (Staub and Le Creuset) are the heaviest, carbon steel comes in second, and HexClad and Ninja are about the same.5- The warranty for HexClad is lifetime vs. the Ninja warranty that is 5-10 year depending on whether you register cookware on the Ninja website. For the HexClad cookware, you must save your purchase receipt.This is all of the differences I can think of for now. If I think of more, I will add them. For now, I am impressed with the HexClad cookware, but I will not likely eliminate much of the cookware I already have. As mentioned previously, each has their own benefits. I may eventually decide to eliminate some of the heavier cookware as it is more difficult to use. I may also eliminate cookware that requires more maintenance.I will update this review if my opinion changes. I hope this review was helpful for you.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Cuisinart 11-Piece Nonstick Cookware Set, Ceramica XT, Black, 733-30H
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cooks & Browns Evenly, Quick Clean Up, Need Very Little Butter &/or Oil to Cook With', 'author': 'Jess', 'rating': 5, 'content': "First thing NEVER use Cooking Spray or EXTRA Virgin Olive Oil because they easily carbonize in your pan or pot very quickly when it is heated. The ingredients used in cooking spray are to harsh for the ceramic coating.Now on with my review:Before purchasing this set of cookwear I did a lot of research and read a lot of reviews for different ceramic cookweare.I selected this set of cookware taking in consideration some of the negative reviews in which I believe people did not take the time to read the do's & don'ts. I also went online and read what kind of oils could be used and not used.Do not use anything abrasive to clean this cookwear. If you have stuck on food soak the pan or pot in warm soapy water for as long as needed.There is no need to add a lot of butter or oil to the pan or pot. Believe it or not your food will cook & brown evenly.Adding a little butter or oil helps the food not to stick and keeps a protective coating between the food & cookware.Use only silicone or plastic utensils that can be safely used on your ceramic cookware.Do Not stack your pan & pots inside one another without putting something between them or they will get scratched.Do Not use high heat with this cookwear because the heat is evenly distributed through out the pan or pot & you only need to be using med to med-high heat.I for the most part use medium heat.Do not deep fry anything in these pans or pots because you will ruin the coating. If you need to fry food use a different type of pan or pot.Now to my review. I got side tracked a little but felt that I had to write the do's & don'ts first.The cookwear was nicely packaged. I wasn't sure if I was going to keep this cookwear because my previous set were heavier, non stick Paula Dean Cookwear.The first thing that I used was the pot to cook red sauce in and was worried that the red sauce would stain the coating. To my surprise it did not stain it. Cleanup was so easy.I have cooked boneless, skinless chicken breast with very little oil and was very surprised of how nicely, evenly it cooked and browned.I cooked four eggs in one of the pans and wanted the yolks cooked all the way. I put a lid on the pan and when I took the lid off a few minutes later the yolks were cooked all the way through. The egg white wasn't even burnt on the edges.Cooking rice is great, easy cooks in no time.Cleaning this cookware is so easy and nice to do.I always wash my pan & pots with dish & warm water.Never use harsh abrasives, pads or sponges.I believe this cookware is wwll worth the money.If you take care of them properly, they will last. You for quite sometime.I hope this review was helpful.Happy cooking!!!Follow up 3 years 3 months later..I am still happy with the purchase of my cookware. They still cook and look really good!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This was amazing set! Wow WAY more than expected, do not hesitate to buy this if at right price', 'author': 'Elise', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'BEAUTIFUL set ! high quality at amazing price. Not Teflon, but healthy for my family -ceramic non stick. *In the last 18 months this is the best product I have purchased from Amazon , hands down.* Glass lids for ALL pans with Cuisinart logo etched on each. Pans are of unique, exactly right sizes for cooking needs w/ handles designed so well, even has steamer similar to double broiler pan. As opened this box ( The packaging is WOW) just happily shocked ,thinking as reached and unwrapped another item ,"Still more?" REALLY! Should have seen the smile on my husband\'s face as watching my reaction. So many items at sizes that make sense for a busy home. Versatile for oven, gas or electric stove top. I place in my frig & do not worry about unhealthy non stick coatings. If replacing cookware -this set would do it ALL- no additions needed. I like to display this set (its very classy) and now cook with complete confidence. Yes, would make a great gift. The workmanship is outstanding, pans cook everything so well. Cleans up so easily. Note ..do not soak these overnight though, just cleanup right away. Mine still look brand new after 18 months of daily use! ...just so happy with this can\'t write enough even over a year later.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 25, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love them', 'author': 'Ranchlady745', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've wanted these pans for about a year. I love them easy cleaning, cooking on them is heavenly, stack great!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great quality', 'author': 'Ultimate005', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is a good buy . 👌', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great and affordable', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'definitely a great buy, this was a gift she loved it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great!', 'author': 'melissa g', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This cookware is exactly what I wanted. Versatile, nonstick and well made. Would recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars Starts strong but doesn't last with any type of cooking error.", 'author': 'Jeni B.', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I've had this set for a little over two years and really liked it to begin with. However with a couple of cooking errors we slowly but surely ruined it and are now replacing it with stainless steel All-clad.The non stick surface is really nice at first. However over time it starts to wear, even with only using silicone utensils and never scrubbing the surface. It doesn't wear the same as a black non-stick pan with coating flaking off but the enamel starts to get slightly discolored and gets sticky over time.The major time the pans get ruined is if you burn something in them. I burned rice in both pots by accident (forgot to set a timer, totally my fault nothing to do with the pans) and they were irreversibly damaged. I couldn't get the rice off the bottom and now the enamel is permanently blacked and slightly burnt tasting. Same thing happened to the frying pan when my husband burned something.Overall it's ok for the money but if you're looking for something long term, this isn't it. Best part is they are super lightweight so it does not fell like you are trying to wash a basketball when doing dishes', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Obsessed with this cookware', 'author': 'Jessica Skupien', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We've been using cast iron cookware for the last couple years, which I've never liked because it was always heavy, difficult to clean, and never felt fully clean even after washing (this very well may be user error but I shouldn't have to work that hard to effectively use a pan). I finally decided to replace the cast iron with something more functional and came across this Sensarte set after reading many reviews of various options across Amazon.After using them for about a month, I can say I have zero regrets about making the switch, as I am completely satisfied with this new cookware!What I love most is that these are truly non stick. Two of the things I cook most often are pancakes and eggs and I don't even need to spray the pan before cooking and yet both food items slide right off.After I’m done cooking, I rarely have to do anything beyond spray them with water and all the remaining food bits slide right off. As someone who hates cooking because it takes so long to prepare and cook food, and then you only eat for like 10 minutes, and then you have to clean it all up after, I very much value pans that take little to no effort to clean.This set feels quite sturdy and will definitely not warp like some other pans I've tried over the years. They even come with pot protectors, which are equally helpful to protect my cabinets shelves from getting scratched. I was also pleased that they come with a silicone spatula and spoon to help you avoid scratching the surface of the cookware.They’re also so much more aesthetically pleasing than cast iron!10/10 recommend. If I ever need to expand the number of pots or pans I have, I would definitely buy more Sensarte products.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars I love this cookware, but I guess I'm in the honeymoon period?", 'author': 'Nathan Ostrander', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Our collection of cookware needed a serious upgrade. Neither the wife or I are what you would call kitchen or cookware experts... we cook a lot, but do not find it to be a source of great enjoyment/passion. Nor are we particularly great at it :) That said, I was not super keen to invest in high end cookware that was likely more than we need. I started looking around on Amazon and came across these Sensarte, granite finish pans. I ordered a single skillet in the interest of exploring, based on their slightly retro vibe, solid reviews and low price point. It shipped quickly and performed admirably in addition to being lovely to look at.We then came across the 8 piece set and decided to toss out all the old, burnt out cookware odds and ends we'd been using for a long while. The price point on the set was a major selling point. At this point, we have used them a bit and couldn't be happier... they fit our whole, funky vibe and the price was right. I'm now planning to order a couple of smaller pots/saucepans to round out our inventory.At this point, I can say that:- They feel great in your hand and on the stove. The slightly rubberized handles are quite nice feeling. They are indeed light as advertised.- We start at a low setting and gradually raise the temp as their directions indicate. The heat seems to distribute quite evenly (also as advertised.)- They also clean up quite easily and are also egg-cellent... for making the eggs (see what I did there?)In summation, would definitely recommend for the average household user. Totally possible that someone with more demanding requirements would want to go up a level or 2 higher, but I think we're going to be quite happy with them and you can't beat the price. If they hold up to my heavy handed cooking for the next few months, I'll probably add a star to this review.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Other than that I do like them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars warranty is trash.', 'author': 'Ryan Nichols', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Says, wont scratch. Day two of receiving this i fried bacon. I did use a metal fork to flip hot greasy bacon,which we all know you’re careful with. skillet looked like a Bob cat ran across it. Severely scratched. Not the sellers fault. They jus sold it. I did email the company, got an response next day. Said they’d value the warranty. Had to send in my proof of purchase, did that day. Been a month now, couple emails sent, nothing Not even a reply. I’d probably stay away from this brand. I divorced my wife, she cleaned me out, iam also a single father. I put in time of research into this company. I thought it was a solid company. Lesson learned. Their customer service is straight thrash. Good luck!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not anywhere near as good as original GraniteStone', 'author': 'Bryan', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I have a similar set of the original Granitestone, the dark grey with white speckles. I really like that cookware and use them daily. This set, the blue 'diamond' cookware, is not close to as good.First, the pans are much thicker metal than the original which makes them bulkier in the cupboard and in the dishwasher.Next, they don't cook as well. They are anti-stick, that much I'll give them, but they are difficult to cook in. Bacon tends to burn, browning ground meat is very difficult and they heat slowly.The dimensions of the saucepans are very odd but I suppose I'll get used to that except that the 5-quart pot is all but useless for cooking pasta. The water never reached a full rolling boil and the pasta took 3 or 4 minutes longer than in my usual pasta pot. That and the steamer tray went to the back of the cupboard and won't come out until I donate them.Finally, the 2.5 qt saucepan arrived with a very nasty ding in the rim, deep enough I had to file it back some just to get a lid to seat.These are a definite 'do not recommend' and I will never buy another piece of blue GraniteStone.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 6, 2021', 'is_verified': True}]

The pots with two handles, those handles do get hot...the one with a single long handle, it doesn't.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars They're really good for what they are!", 'author': 'Michael K.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Good pots, good lids.They're not non-stick, which is good.I really like them a lot!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 6 pieces stackable Pot set', 'author': 'Princess kobbah', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I receive my order early this morning on October 2. I thought it was a large set but I love it. It’s beautiful it good for a little steel when you are cooking in it. this 6 pieces stackable pot set it is incredible and fantastic. I love the design of it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Single person starter set', 'author': 'Winchester2', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I had to give up some of my smaller saucepans once I switched over to induction cooking because they weren’t induction ready. This set of three pans was exactly the sizes I was looking for to replace them being 2 quart, 2.6 quart and 3.7 quart. It’s perfect for the single person, college student out on their own or maybe even a couple who doesn’t cook big meals. The pans have sturdy handles, glass covers so you can check on your food without lifting the lid letting heat escape and best of all, thick solid bottoms which is a necessity when using induction. They aren’t heavy, but as I get older, not having cookware that weighs a ton isn’t exactly a bad thing.I wouldn’t necessarily call these pans non-stick. The interiors are polished, but foods stick to stainless steel very easily so you should use butter or oil to help the food along. I tried a couple of the pans and food cooked very quickly on my induction burners. Water was boiling in just a few minutes. They actually performed better than my current set of pans and I think that is due to the flat bottoms of the new pans while my older set is probably warped from use and not making contact as fully as they should.Just a couple of things to know. The covers don’t fit tightly. Not a big deal, but the cover clanking around makes them noisy. There are no instructions on how to attach the metal handles to the glass covers. Just study the photos and you’ll figure it out. There seem to be two different sets of these pans. The photos on this page show thick double handles on the sides of all the pans. The set I received has thin handles and the smallest saucepan has a single open handle that sticks out. I prefer that format for such a small pan. All in all, I’m pretty happy with this set so far.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Calphalon 10-Piece Pots and Pans Set, Nonstick Kitchen Cookware with Stay-Cool Stainless Steel Handles, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars WONDERFUL PAN SET!', 'author': 'Cindy B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'NOTHING has stuck to these pans! Easy cleaning ! (I hand wash) They cook evenly and are a dream to own!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent product', 'author': 'Ann E. Lytle', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Came packaged very well! Very easy to clean. Great product and the price was fantastic for this quality of product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent cookware', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I researched different products for a while before I made this purchase. This is the product I ultimate decided on and have no regrets. These products checked all the boxes, cook ability, cleaning ease and overall performance. The small sauce pan is only 1 quart (small) so I ended up purchasing a 3 quart sauce pan (same brand) to complete set.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Simply Calphalon or Kitchen Aid KCH1S10KD ?', 'author': 'HTD', 'rating': 4, 'content': "First, I did not receive these products for free, I bought them. The Simply Calphalon was rated a best buy by CR and I thought that the specs for the Kitchen Aid KitchenAid KCH1S10KD Hard Anodized Nonstick 10-Piece Cookware Set - Black Diamond made them worth consideration. I have been in the restaurant business for over 30 years so I have a lot of experience with pans, mostly professional sets. So that is my point of reference. The Calphalon and Kitchen Aid were in the same mid-range price point (170 - 220) in November of 2015. Truthfully they are very similar but not equal.First thing I noticed was that the Simply Calphalon were slightly smaller. Especially the Saute pan. The Kitchen Aid set is dishwasher safe, Calphalon is not. For better or worse (as you'll read better in this case) the Kitchen Aid are heavier. The Calphalon are double-coated nonstick, the Kitchen Aid are triple-coated. Packaging for KA says oven safe to 350 degrees and Cal. says 400. Amazon says 500 for KA vs 400 for Cal. Being curious I had both in the oven at 425 for 15 minutes with no issues. Both are Hard Anodized aluminum. If you have an induction cooktop only KA is compatable.What is Hard Anodized and does it matter? Hard Anodized pans are naturally nonstick, and completely chemical-free. These pans are made with an aluminum base, which essentially gets submerged in a sulfuric acid bath that has low electrical charges running through it. As it cools, it causes the pans exterior to anodize. A hard anodized pan is extremely strong, has a long lifespan, and because it is virtually non-porous, it resists sticking. Add a few layers of non-stick coating and you have a great, relatively cheap (cost wise), pan.So what are meaningful differences? The most important, and the one most often overlooked by consumers, is that Calphalon set is 3.2mm thick and the Kitchen Aid is 4.5mm thick. Meaning (all else being equal) the Kitchen Aid is more thermally conductive and durable. And my non-scientific tests show this. The KA heats up far quicker, stays at temp longer and cooks more evenly. It's not even close. Boiling water took about 1:30 less time in the KA and eggs cooked over medium heat in far less time. I had to lower the heat on everything I tested with the KA set. It conducted heat far better that my old Cuisinart or the Simply Calphalon. The difference in thickness also accounts for the difference in weight.Calphalon double-coated and KA has a triple-coated non-stick coating. The name is pretty explanatory but does it really matter? Yes and no. Right out of the box there is no noticible difference. However, in 4-5 years there should be a difference. Kitchen Aid's triple-coating should last longer and look better. We'll wait and see.The Kitchen Aid is dishwasher safe the Simply Calphalon is not. Truthfully, I don't care what the manufacture says if you want you cookware to last don't put it in the dishwasher. With the non-stick coating it takes little effort to clean these so it's not worth it. Also, don't use metal instruments and never use cooking spray. Buy silicon utensils and a oil mister. The utensils are cheap and a mister lasts forever and is less expensive than 2 cans of Pam.Real world cooking experience. After spending a week with each I gave the Calphalon to my son who recently moved out. They are nice pans and should take most of his abuse but they do not compare with the Kitchen Aid set. Cooking is quicker, food cooks more evenly and they look great. The deep black finish and flat tops are a stark change from the grey, domed cookware you usually see. I did find that the handles of the Calphalon set were slightly more comfortable. But that is subjective. Anyway who holds their pans for more than 10 seconds at a time?Neither sets handles became hot but, as expected, the handles on the lids of both became hot.Lastly, while I like the look of the flat lids on the Kitchen Aid set, they do have issues. Domed lids like those on the Cal. set allow the condensation to continually drain. The flat lids tend to collect the condensation so that when you remove them... water everywhere. You quickly learn to tilt them as you remove but it is something of which to be aware.Are they a professional set, no. But restaurants cook 300+ meals a day with people who don't care if the pans last to the next shift. So why pay triple the price? Well, the speed at which a 6mm or 7mm thick set gets to temp. is nice but that's the only difference. Usually, the Kitchen Aid set is slightly more than the Simply Calphalon but the they are worth the difference. So, for a mid-priced set of cookware, I don't think you'll find a better value than the Kitchen Aid.I hope this is helpful in your decision. Be well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight set, great for older folks', 'author': 'Sofia B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought the set as a gift for my mother in law. I was looking for a set that was light but still good quality and meant to actually be used regularly. Look forward to years of use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Mixed feelings', 'author': 'Pugpro', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Looks nice and doesn't stick.But I haven't figured out the right temperature for cooking yet. And yes fluids run to the edges. Which doesn't bother me. I always use water to cook through steam. I have a glass top stove and have to get it very hot to get this pan to cook.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Review after six months of use.', 'author': 'Alea', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I promised myself I would come back and write a review six months after buying these pans. They were a gift for my mother.Upon arrival, she had a great experience. The item arrived on time, with no defects and the packaging was pristine. Everything that was supposed to be in the box, was in it.Cooking with them was a great experience, it actually still is. These DO have a nonstick feature and they DO heat up well. You can feel the quality in the weight and they are most certainly stackable. If you are concerned about the functionality - you won\'t be.However, the unfortunate thing about these pans is that they will not look great after a few months. If you are like my mother, and you cook at home every day, you will be privy to dark food marks from meats, grease stains and a potential rusty-look EVEN after washing and drying. You could, probably, remedy this with a pan cleaner product. Your permanent problem will more or less be the scratches that these EASILY get. You can try to prevent that by NEVER using metal utensils on them, and stacking them very carefully.In conclusion, I love that these work. That\'s what I had ultimately intended for my mother. She seems satisfied with the fact that they work. But I can tell she is not super jazzed about how they look right now, especially when we are coming up on the holidays and we will be having guests over. It kind of upsets me that she would have had to seriously "baby" these pans to get them to keep their appearance.I would honestly not buy these pans again for this reason. Like my mother, I take pride in being able to visually show off my cooking skills to anyone watching. It\'s just not fun to have people see these pans after a while.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2021', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Gotham Steel 20 Pc Pots and Pans Set, Bakeware Set, Ceramic Cookware Set for Kitchen, Long Lasting Non Stick Pots and Pans Set with Lids Dishwasher / Oven Safe, Non Toxic-Copper
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Gothic Steel Cook Ware Set', 'author': 'DRE42', 'rating': 5, 'content': "As a home cook, I'm always on the lookout for durable and reliable cookware that can withstand the rigors of my kitchen. Enter Gothic Steel cooking ware – a game-changer in my culinary arsenal. First and foremost, durability is paramount, and Gothic Steel delivers on this front. Crafted from high-quality materials, their cookware stands up to heavy use without showing signs of wear and tear. Whether I'm searing meats, sautéing vegetables, or simmering sauces, I have confidence that my Gothic Steel pots and pans can handle whatever I throw their way.Beyond durability, the cooking performance of Gothic Steel products is truly exceptional. Thanks to their even heat distribution, I can achieve consistent results with every dish. From perfectly seared steaks to flawlessly cooked pasta, these pans never fail to impress.Another standout feature of Gothic Steel cookware is its non-stick surface. Even without the need for excessive oil or butter, I can effortlessly release food from the pan, making cleanup a breeze. Plus, the non-stick coating is incredibly durable, standing up to frequent use and easy to maintain.In terms of design, Gothic Steel strikes the perfect balance between elegance and functionality. With sleek, modern aesthetics, their cookware looks right at home in any kitchen. The ergonomic handles provide a comfortable grip, while the tempered glass lids allow me to monitor cooking progress without releasing heat.Overall, I couldn't be more satisfied with my experience using Gothic Steel cooking ware. From its durability and performance to its user-friendly design, it's clear that this brand has mastered the art of creating top-notch cookware.
